title: System Test Engineer to Excillum!
description:
Do you want to work with the company behind the world´s brightest X-ray source? Great, then you´ve come to the right place! Excillum is a leading company in the field of high-end microfocus and nanofocus X-ray sources and was founded in 2007 by researchers from the Royal Institute of Technology (KTH). As a System Test Engineer at Excillum, you will be part of a company with a friendly and helpful work environment with humble and motivated colleagues, who all contribute to enable new science, improve medicine and enhance manufacturing by continuous development of state-of-the-art X-ray sources.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Excillum Aktiebolag
 



  

**City :**
 Kista
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
   




**About the role**

 Excillum designs, develops, and manufactures X-ray sources with the world's highest brightness and with the world’s smallest spot depending on which product line you look at. The X-ray sources are used in a wide range of areas including quality assurance in semiconductors, electronics, and battery manufacturing. Other application areas are in the development of new medicine and research for example in biology, medicine, and material science. Since the start in 2007, Excillum has grown and today we are around 80 employees in Stockholm. You will be part of a growing international company with customers all over the world and you will play an important role in the work verifying our sources. Excillum is characterized by a strong engineering culture and except from your team, you will collaborate with experts in, for example, electronics, software, research, production and sales. Excillum site is in Kista with both lab and production in-house, which means that you will work close to the products you are developing.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* The opportunity to grow with the company
  
* The opportunity to influence working methods and share your knowledge
  
* A company with a friendly and helpful work culture where we listen to each other
  

  


**Work tasks**

 You will part of the newly established System & Test group at Excillum, meaning you will play an important role in building up this position and help Excillum create a vision and strategy for their testing. The goal of the role is dual; both to ensure the design of new products and that they can be tested systematically in production. This includes understanding customer demands, the current test set-up and identifying a strategy to meet customer expectations. As Excillum is a small company this is a broad role where you are encouraged to take overall responsibility and dive into a range of tasks which could include different types of test, review of manuals or customer interactions.
 


  


 You will for example...
 


  

  
* Work in cross-functional projects collaborating with different engineering disciplines as well as product management, service and production.
  
* Conduct hands-on testing, analyze results and together with the team come up with improvements.
  
* Create and implement the production line with appropriate tests.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 For this position, and at Excillum in general, we attach great importance to you as a person and your interest for the position and the company. We believe in the right attitude!
 


  


 Since this is an important role at Excillum, you also need…
 


  

  
* A bachelor or master’s degree within electronics, mechatronics, physics or similar
  
* Several years of work experience with test of industrial products containing both hardware and software
  
* Knowledge in different types of tests
  
* Experience of automated testing. Able to set up automatic test environment and write tests
  
* Experience from production test
  
* Strong knowledge in English
  


  


  

**Other information**



  

  
* Start: Immediate, but an eventual notice period or other circumstances will be considered
  
* Work extent: Fulltime
  
* Location: Kista in Stockholm, Sweden
  
* This recruitment process is conducted by Academic Work. It is a request from Excillum that all questions regarding the position are handled by Academic Work.
  
* Contact information: Recruitment Consultant Johanna Sörell, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* Our selection process is ongoing and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the screening or interview phase.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Excillum Aktiebolag**

 Read more about Excillum on their website: https://www.excillum.com/
   




**Get directly recruited to Excillum Aktiebolag**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.

 Johanna Sörell or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stv3@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106268

title: Game Mathematician
description:
To design our slot games isn't an easy task - especially not the mechanic side of the games. If you're a great dude/gal with amazing math skills that is up for the challenge - then we're very interested to get in contact with you. We've got one thing which is important; you need to have great knowledge in casino products and hopefully also slots experience, and a general passion for games.
   

  

 Who you are
   

  

* You have a fantastic understanding for what makes a game exciting and fun.
* In a team environment consisting of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, game development and server development, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Good knowledge of and solid experience of working with Java is a must.
* Your strong analytical skills will help us to follow up on game performance to make the next game even better.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Atlassian Senior Technical Administrator
description:
**Job purpose summary:** 
 Technically responsible for the Sinch Atlassian Enterprise Platform together with the Atlassian Platform Owner. This includes setting the technical strategies for integrations and supporting the technical implementation of the strategic goals defined by the Atlassian Platform Owner. Handling technical support tickets from the users and acting as the platform architect towards internal groups at Sinch.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm, and you must be able to work from the office when the team meets there from time to time.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are looking for someone that can take ownership of the technical aspects of our Atlassian Platform together with the Atlassian Platform Owner. This includes taking ownership of things like integrations and configurations in the Atlassian products in alignment with the strategic goals set by the Atlassian Platform Owner.
   

  

 As the technical administrator we also see that you lead the technical support such as incidents and requests for configuration and integrations together with the Atlassian Support technician in the team. We also need you to handle consultation with our customers to understand their needs so we can build a solution that is based on best practices and our strategic plans.
   

  

**Please, submit your resume in English!**
**Key Responsibilities**
* Work hands-on with Sinch Atlassian Platform support.
* Drive excellent technical implementation
* Assist with setting up the technical strategies with the Atlassian Platform Owner
* Providing information, improvement areas and overall status to the Atlassian Platform Owner
* Defining strategy for integrations towards other platforms in alignment with the Atlassian Platform Owner and the Atlassian platform strategies
* Collaborate with other team leads for the IT-Support/Infra/Security teams across Sinch.
* Deliver end-user training to ensure effective utilization of Atlassian tools
* Drive improvement projects and ensure documentation are created and maintained
* Ensure the Atlassian Enterprise platform have high technical quality and security
* Completing assigned tasks promptly with autonomy, communicating progress effectively
* Understanding and adhering to project timelines
* Voicing delivery risks and providing solutions
* Foster teamwork through excellent communication and collaboration
* Lead client engagements and project delivery


**Requirements**
**Key general competencies:**
* Personal drive and a good people's person
* The ability to shoulder complex situations
* Ability to keep multiple tasks active at once
* Comfortable with training users in the tools
* Proven documentational and process-oriented work experience
* Full English proficiency


**Technical Proficiencies**
* Expert implementation and configuration of Atlassian's suite of products, including Jira (JSM, JSW, JWM, JPD), Confluence, Opsgenie, Statuspage, and other related plugins and integrations
* Familiar with common and preferred marketplace applications
* General operating system knowledge
* Familiar with project management methodologies and practices including but not limited to Service Management, ITIL, ITSM, and associated methodologies
* Proficient in best practices related to Atlassian Cloud systems and SaaS systems
* Basic knowledge and understanding of:
+ databases including Structured Query Language (SQL)
+ various networks and infrastructures


**Key Technical Competencies**
* Minimum five years of technical proficiency with Atlassian, Jira (JWS, JSM, JWM, JPD)
* Minimum five years of technical proficiency with Confluence
* Minimum three years of customer facing consulting experience with an Atlassian product(s)
* Minimum of three years of project management methodologies and practices including but not limited to Service Management, ITIL, ITSM, and associated methodologies
* Managing product documentation in Confluence
* Health & maintenance tracking of the Atlassian instances and apps.
* If you also have experience with any of these, we consider that as a plus:
+ Experience with Groovy scripting
+ Experience working with ScriptRunner
+ Experience with EazyBI
+ Experience with Assets


**Benefits**
 Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.
   

  

**Our Hiring Process**
 In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently work towards identifying the candidates that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.
   

  

 We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new ideas and perspectives to Sinch!

title: Resande Servicetekniker till Benning
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Nu söker vi dig som är du ute efter en roll där du får arbeta med kunder över hela Sverige. Vill du kombinera ditt tekniska intresse med en social roll med mycket frihet under ansvar? Då kan detta vara en roll för dig. Sök tjänsten som resande Servicetekniker till Benning redan idag- urval sker löpande!

 BENNING erbjuder avancerade avbrottsfria kraftsystem som säkrar driften av kritiska processer till användare inom Industri-, Energi-samt Telecom. Företaget ingår i BENNING koncernen med huvudkontor i Tyskland och deras svenska verksamhet ansvarar för den nordiska marknaden.
 


  


 I rollen som resande servicetekniker kommer du att jobba med Bennings eftermarknadsverksamhet. Du ansvarar för att hjälpa kunder med driftsättningar, akut- och avtalsservice samt underhåll av Benning system. Internt kommer du ha kontakt med produktion-, konstruktion- och säljavdelningen och externt har du kontakt med Bennings kunder runt om i Sverige. Du kommer att ingå i ett team med två andra servicetekniker och din närmsta chef kommer att vara bolagets Servicechef.

* Skriva protokoll på utfört arbete

 Det är meriterande och din ansökan kommer att prioriteras om du har:
 


  

  
* Erfarenhet av fältservice av UPS-/strömförsörjningsutrustning.
  
* El behörighet B
  


  


  

**Tjänsten innefattar resor inom Sverige vilket kräver en personlig situation som tillåter resor. Övernattningar förekommer också.**



  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Hjälpsam
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Socialt självsäker
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 


  


 Vår kund kommer att vara på sommarsemester vilket gör att intervjuer hos Benning kommer att ske under v.33-34.
   




**Benning Sweden AB**

 Läs mer om Benning Sweden AB här !
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Benning Sweden AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sofia Axelsson eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på recruitmentstockholmsouth@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105317

title: Fullstack data developer to well known company
description:
Are you a skilled Data engineer with experience from from the whole data-stack and looking for your next assignment? Look no further. We are on the lookout for a Full stack Data developer with start as soon as possible!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Solna
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, at least 10 months
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 The position includes working closely with the business to identify issues and use data to propose solutions for effective decision making. It also includes designing or coding /building experiments to merge, manage, interrogate, and extract data to supply tailored reports to colleagues, customers, or the wider organization. You will work as part of a Scrum team and interact with business users to understand the requirements.
   




**Work tasks**
  
* Develop and implement logical data models
  
* Optimize data schema for read and write performance and storage
  
* Design, develop and maintain data pipelines for data ingestion and transformation. Performance tune data pipelines
  
* Ensure data quality and consistency in developed data products
  
* Set up and manage infrastructure resources for building data pipelines including database, cloud storage resources, data pipeline run time environments
  

  


**We are looking for**

 You who are proficient in data modeling (dimensional, normalization), database systems, data warehousing, and distributed computing. Experienced in Python, SQL, data processing frameworks (Apache Spark, Pandas), and data pipeline orchestration (Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Apache Airflow). Skilled in using Git, CI/CD pipelines, REST APIs, Kafka, and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes). Familiar with deploying infrastructure with YAML and Terraform on cloud platforms like Azure, GCP, or AWS.
 


  


 To get this experience you have at least 3 years experience working with data product solutions and concepts.
 


  

  
* Language: English fluent. Swedish is a plus
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.

title: Communication Officer PWM&FO | SEB, Stockholm
description:
SEB is looking for an experienced communications professional for the role of Communication Officer for our Private Wealth Management & Family Office Division (PWM&FO). You will be developing the strategic communication plan, as well as hands-on executing on it.
   

  

 At SEB, our employees are at the core for our ability to be a successful company that support our customers in fulfilling their ambitions. To work at SEB is to be a part of positively shaping the future, with responsible advice and capital.
   

  

**About the PWM&FO division:**
 For more than 165 years, SEB has been a trusted partner to some of the Nordics' most successful entrepreneurs, private individuals, families, and foundations. The PWM&FO division helps our clients to achieve their ambitions with expertise, innovation, and a large international network. We offer our clients comprehensive banking and advisory services, access to capital markets, financing solutions and individually tailored advisory services across SEB’s home markets and international markets. The personal contact and long-term relationships are central to our offering.
   

  

**About the role:**
 You will be part of an experienced team of communication professionals, and report to the Head of Narrative & Engagement. The Narrative & Engagement team is responsible for SEB’s internal communication on group level, of which a key part is to inform, inspire and engage employees in strategically important themes such as SEB’s long term-strategy and business plan, SEB’s purpose and behaviours, sustainability, the bank’s role in society as well empowering employees for a customer centric approach.
   

  

 As a communicator for the PWM&FO division, you will, together with your colleagues in PWM&FO and Group Marketing & Communication, set and develop the communication plan for the division, as well as hands-on executing on it.
   

  

 The role and delivery of PWM&FO communication includes:
   

  

* Set and follow-up the division’s communication strategy in line with the division’s strategic initiatives, the Marketing strategy & plan, and the Group communication strategy.
* Align, advise and coordinate PWM&FO related communication, support in making key messages clear and understandable and ensure that the communication is aligned with the bank’s communication on group level.
* Drive and support external communication initiatives, in close collaboration with Group Marketing & Communication, as well as internal communication initiatives. This includes setting communication strategies and communication plans for various projects and issues.
* Support internal communication within the division to build knowledge, engagement and efficiency and equip employees with the appropriate Marketing & Communication tools.
* Support the division, including the leadership team, with communication advice and content, for example related to strategic initiatives and All staff meetings.
* Together with the Marketing team, support the offerings & service communication including communicating the division’s knowledge and expertise, packaging key offering and support product launches, building the online presence and developing the digital content hub.
* Building a content and channel strategy for client communication based on different client segments’ needs.
* Support various collaborations, events, and other initiatives.
* The assessment, planning, writing and publishing of news, articles and other content and ensuring a coherent approach and optimised outcome across communication channels.
* Support spokespersons in the division in close collaboration with the Media Relations & External Communication team.


 You will work closely with other colleagues within Group Brand, Marketing and Communication and the PWM&FO division, as well as the bank’s other divisions and functions, experts, and other stakeholders.
   

  

 As a member of the Narrative & Engagement team, you will also, when relevant, be part of Group communication projects within the bank’s strategically important themes mentioned above.
   

  

 These responsibilities include:
   

  

* Supporting with content and messaging in various channels and formats, such as the bank’s financial communication, strategic events, and internal and external communication channels.
* Coordinating and contributing to content in strategically important themes on group level.
* Assisting with key messages and communication plans in the event of issues or crises.


**To thrive in this role, we believe you have:**
 Between 3-7 years of experience within communication, preferably in a listed company or financial institution. Ideally, you have previous experience from as well as editorial experience. You should have excellent written and verbal skills in both Swedish and English, and an academic education in journalism, public relations, communication, economics, political science or other related fields. The ideal candidate is curious, a fast learner, constantly willing to take on new challenges and skilled in stakeholder management. It is important to have a collaborative, strategic and operational mindset. In addition, the ideal candidate is proactive, driven, analytical, well-structured and can handle many projects in parallel, while meeting deadlines.
   

  

**What we offer:**
* We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
* Friendly and welcoming culture
* Extensive training and learning opportunities
* Chances to make an impact on social or environmental issues
* Agile and modern ways of working
* Empowering environment


**Do you want to be part of SEB?**
 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 25th of August 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Afroditi Kellberg at afroditi.kellberg@seb.se .
   

  

 Please be aware that the recruitment process and response time might take a bit longer than usual during the summer due to the holidays.
   

  

**Learn more about working at SEB** 
 www.sebgroup.com/career
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected, and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Tysktalande teknisk innesäljare till internationellt företag!
description:
Om du vill vara delaktig i att bygga upp en ny avdelning med tekniska innesäljare har du hittat rätt tjänst för dig. I denna tjänst kommer du att arbeta med både kortare och längre säljprocesser som är uppdelade inom geografiska områden. Du kommer ha egna kunder som du driver försäljning hos med bas ifrån kontoret och du får möjligheten att utvecklas hos ett redan stort men starkt växande företag.
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Försäljning
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid, helst på kontoret
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Kunden arbetar med IT-baserade säkerhetslösningar och är en växande aktör på marknaden. De utökar nu sin säljverksamhet med ett innesäljarteam som kommer att fokusera på små och medelstora företag. Du kommer ansvara för att bygga långsiktiga relationer med fokus på kundnöjdhet, till en början med befintliga kunder men när du blivit varm i kläderna kommer du även att arbeta med egna prospekt. Du får möjlighet att vara med i hela processen tillsammans med kunden och stötta dem i mindre enmansuppdrag till stora, komplexa installationer och lösningar.
   




**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Ansvara över en stor del av företagets konton och driva tillväxt
  
* Skapa långsiktiga relationer med nya och befintliga kunder
  
* Arbeta proaktivt med kunder för att enkelt möta deras behov när det dyker upp
  
* Se nya lösningar för att hjälpa kunden hitta den bästa lösningen för sitt problem
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har
   

**relevant**
 erfarenhet inom försäljning av ex. SAAS/passérlösning/säkerhetsinstallatör(ej larm)
  
* Har minst en avslutad gymnasieutbildning, helst inom teknik
  
* Har goda kunskaper i Tyska och Engelska i tal och skrift då det kommer att användas i det dagliga arbetet
   

 Det är högt meriterande om du har kunskaper i andra sydeuropeiska språk.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**
  

 Vi ser att du har möjlighet att själv driva ditt arbete framåt och du är inte rädd för att ta upp telefonen och ringa kunden. Du stället hellre en fråga för mycket, och trivs att arbeta tillsammans med andra. Vi ser att du har hög ambition och gärna vill utvecklas och lära dig. Vi kommer att fokusera på följande personliga egenskaper under rekryteringsprocessen:
 


  

  
* Resultatinriktad
  
* Strukturerad
  
* Serviceinriktad
  
* Självgående
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och annonsen kan därmed komma att tas ned innan sista ansökningsdag om det är så att vi har gått vidare till urvals- och intervjufas. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
 



 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Sofia Wahren eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på ste03@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106078

title: Product Manager to AXS
description:
*We are looking for a passionate and experienced Product Manager who wants to make a difference in the sports and music industry! In this role you will provide product expertise for our global consumer facing suite of applications, ensuring they meet both business goals and customer needs. If you are driven by making a tangible impact and be a part of a global development team, this is the perfect opportunity for you!*
**About The Job**
 AXS is looking for a talented and motivated professional to join our Product Management team in Stockholm, Sweden as a Product Manager. In this highly visible role, you will be working closely with your peers, you will participate in the product and feature discovery process, help elicit requirements and ensure what we build aligns with our strategic initiatives and business goals. Furthermore, you take great care to ensure what we build is ultimately delivered through product development and into the hands of our clients. Your extensive product management knowledge and understanding of the industry provides the best recipe for execution and guidance across our development teams.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:**
* Understand the opportunities that our business and our fans desire through research and interaction with stakeholders and consumer data.
* Turn input and feedback into solutions that make our suite of applications even better.
* Work closely with internal teams (Tech, Sales, Finance, Client Services) to identify features for the roadmap.
* Participate in planning and execution of strategic initiatives and tactical activities throughout the product life cycle.
* Excellent analytical skills with an understanding of Web Analytics, engagement KPI's and a mature understanding of how to build business cases, measure benefits and communicate results
* Use your product management knowledge and experience to juggle multiple projects with competing priorities.
* Evangelize and communicate the value of our products and services.
* Demonstrate our three pillars to success - Trust, Influence and Impact.


**WHO ARE YOU?**
* Minimum 3 years’ experience in Product Management is required.
* Bachelor’s degree required. Earning an MBA is a plus.
* Experience managing B2C products is required.
* Demonstrate the product management discipline when working on projects.
* Discovery experience collecting qualitative customer feedback and quantitative data to inform decisions.
* Proven success in building products that scale and meet customer needs.
* Demonstrable experience collaborating with cross-functional teams, across geographies, including executive management, product management, operations, sales and marketing.
* Excellent presentation, written, and verbal communication skills, with an eye for quality and attention to detail.
* Fluent in Swedish and English written and verbal.


**About Us**
 AXS connects fans with the artists and teams they love. Each year we sell millions of tickets to thousands of incredible events – from concerts and festivals to sports and theater – at some of the most iconic venues in the world. Since our founding in 2011, we’ve consistently pushed the industry forward and improved experiences for fans, making it easier than ever to discover events, find the perfect seats, and enjoy unforgettable live entertainment, and we continue to lead the evolution of our industry today.
   

  

 We’re passionate about improving the fan experience and providing game-changing solutions for our clients, and we’re always looking for smart, motivated people to help make it happen. Bring your enthusiasm, your big ideas, and your desire to team up with some of the best and brightest in technology and entertainment. Together we keep the world cheering.
   

  

**What’s in it for You?**
* An opportunity to provide product expertise for our global consumer facing suite of applications
* Extraordinary People – we’re not kidding!
* Meaningful Mission - Helping revolutionize an industry and deliver better experiences for fans and clients around the world.
* Opportunities for learning and leveling up through training and education reimbursement.


**Application & contact**
 In this recruitment, AXS is collaborating with Wise IT. If you would like to know more about the job, please contact the responsible recruitment consultant, Anja Widell, at anja.widell@wiseit.se.
   

  

 Unfortunately, Wise IT cannot accept applications via email, as we value your personal privacy. You can read more about how we handle personal data according to GDPR in the Wise Group's policy for the processing of personal data.
   

  

 Selection is ongoing. Welcome with your application!

title: Test & Commissioning Engineer to leading company in the railway industry!
description:
Are you a detail-oriented engineer with a passion for ensuring the safety and efficiency of cutting-edge rail systems? On behalf of our client, we're looking for a Testing and Commissioning Engineer to play a key role in bringing their innovative transportation solutions to life. If you thrive in dynamic environments and have solid experience in field signal technology within the railway industry, this could be your dream job - Apply today!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 ASAP
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a world-leading supplier of railway systems, committed to creating a long-term sustainable transportation system. Here, you will join a secure and skilled workplace that values an inclusive and responsible culture. This culture forms the foundation of the company's commitment to helping its employees grow, learn, and advance in their careers.
 


  


 As a Test & Commissioning Engineer you are offered a varied role where you will work with testing and commissioning of electrical motors and gearboxes to ensure they meet industry standards and specifications. You will conduct functional tests, load tests, and performance evaluations to verify the proper operation of motors and gearboxes and also install our client's equipment in the field.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* An exciting workplace with an international touch
  
* A meaningful role at a company with a focus on sustainability
  
* A dedicated consultant manager who acts as your business partner and support throughout the entire process
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Signal engineering background (in field) with at least 2 years of experience
  
* Experience in installing signaling equipment
  
* Able to communicate fluently in English
