title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer
description:
We are one of the key players in the Nordic region insurance field. Our IT unit takes care of insurance systems across the Baltics and Scandinavian countries. We are working with a broad scope of various in-house projects to keep our primary business growing. Furthermore, we consider ourselves Cloud citizens as our daily work revolves on top of cloud-based solutions. We are constantly growing. That's why we are looking for an addition to our team.
 



  





**About the role** 




 In this role, you will be part of the IT Industrial Risk Systems team, which develops systems for our underwriters and risk engineers at If Industrial. As a senior quality assurance engineer, you will collaborate with experienced colleagues in a cross-functional agile development team, delivering significant value to our users in every sprint.
 



  





 We develop and support complex business solutions used by major companies in the Nordics and thousands of clients globally. Our primary goal is to address the business needs effectively. We take pride in creating exceptional tools, solutions, and software for business purposes. In this role, you will utilize agile methodologies and logical thinking daily.
 



  





**About the team** 




 IT Industrial Risk Systems consists of four agile development teams. Each team consists of three to four developers and a quality assurance engineer who work together as a cross-functional agile team. The teams work in close collaboration with both product owners on the business side and architects to ensure that we deliver the right things in the right way.
 



  





**We offer** 




 In the same way that we place high demands on you as an employee, we also expect you to place high demands on us as an employer. Here are some of the benefits of working at If:
 


* An including work environment where everyone is welcome
* Career and development opportunities in the biggest insurance company in the Nordics
* Social activities, as well as highly skilled professional environment
* Possibility of hybrid workplace
* Health promoting workplace with e.g., wellness allowance and various sports activities
* Great insurance benefits
* Lunch benefit
* High pension savings



  





**Who are you?** 




 You are passionate about your work and committed to ensuring high-quality deliveries, proactively seeking to improve quality at every stage of development. Your high degree of self-motivation and ability to incorporate feedback enable you to deliver the best possible outcomes within the given timeframe and scope.
 



  





 You ensure the necessary quality level for software deliveries by identifying the test scope for systems, providing estimates of the test efforts required, and performing test planning for each iteration. You conduct and maintain sufficient test design, actively communicate with business users for requirements analysis and testing and own the test process by controlling the test scope and managing test deliverables. Additionally, you participate in the development of test automation scope and suggest improvements to enhance the overall testing process.
 



  





**You also have:** 



* Fluency in English
* High sense of responsibility and risk awareness
* Team player spirit with a natural appetite for learning, challenging yourself and sharing knowledge
* 5+ years of experience in software testing
* Higher education in QA methodologies or certifications within ISTQB
* Experience of working according to Agile principles
* Good technical competence – SQL selects, API testing.



  





**Nice to have:** 



* Azure DevOps knowledge
* Basic understanding of planet Azure
* Ability to read and understand C#
* Create tests in Gherkin syntaxis
* Knowledge of insurance domain



  





**Additional facts and recruitment process** 




**To apply for the position** 
 : Screening and interviewing will start immediately. However, application deadline is 30th of August 2024.
 



**Work location** 
 : Sweden (Bergshamra).
 



**Start** 
 : By agreement.
 



  





 For more information, please contact
 **Johan Waessman** 
 , Delivery Manager, Risk Systems Domain, johan.waessman@if.se. Notice that we are not able to process any applications via email.
 



  





 Read more about our Tech Community at If and how we together create tech that matters: www.if.se/tech.
 



  





 Final candidates will undergo a background check before a job offer can be presented. In addition to references, candidates can also be checked via the internet and social media.
 



  





 We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Field Marketing Specialist (Remote)
description:
**OUR HIRING PROCESS:**
* We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals—every person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
* We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
* At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
* From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.


 We are seeking a spunky and dynamic marketing professional to join our team in Europe as a Field Marketing Specialist.
   

  

 As the Field Marketing Specialist, you will play a crucial role in shaping and enhancing our brand's reputation and visibility, and effectively organize and plan programs and events in order to drive demand. Ideally, you've seen the importance of field marketing strategies and campaigns in taking a brand and demand gen to the next level in the broader European region. If you love collaborating cross-functionally and being part of an international team, we'd love to meet you!
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop strategies to capture a larger share of the market in key countries.
* Coordinate and execute integrated, omnichannel sales and marketing campaigns with localized content and marketing campaigns, focusing on evergreen campaigns.
* Coordinate direct mail campaigns for local holidays and maintain event calendar.
* Support strategic account-based initiatives with highly targeted and personalized outreach.
* Attend, support, and measure the success of trade shows, and conferences.
* Ensure the team's adherence to project timelines and achievement of key performance indicators.
* Produce post-campaign evaluation reports to facilitate ROI analysis.


 What you bring
   

  

* 2+ years of proven experience as a Field Marketing Specialist or similar role within the B2B marketing industry
* Excellent understanding of demand generation, marketing concepts, and best practices
* Proficiency in marketing automation software and CRM tools
* Exceptional communication, presentation, and organizational skills
* Ability to work independently, take initiative and handle multiple projects simultaneously
* Willingness to travel as needed

title: Lagertekniker
location: Upplands Väsby och Sollentuna, Stockholm County, Sweden
description:
Vi på Iver växer och letar efter fler talanger som vill vara med på vår resa. Vi ger samma löfte till våra kollegor som till kunder. Löftet är att alltid vara "beside you", "behind you" och "before you". Vi kallar det för "The Iver way".
   

  

 Nu söker vi en
 **Lagertekniker inom IT** 
 som vill bli en del av Iver och som vill vara med och bidra till bättre IT-lösningar som gör skillnad för våra kunder! Är du vår nya kollega?
   

  

**Din roll på Iver?**
 Iver är en ledande nordisk leverantör av molnbaserade IT-tjänster. I rollen som
 **Lagertekniker inom IT** 
 kommer du att tillhöra ett team som ansvarar för att våra kunder får en komplett livscykelhantering av datorer och mobila enheter. Där vi utifrån lagret i Rotebro levererar Ivers totala volym av klienter samt kringutrustning till kunder inom Skandinavien och övriga Europa.
   

  

 Rotebro är Ivers nya recycling-, logistik- och konfigurationscenter för IT-hårdvara på totalt 1800 m2. Tillsammans med våra partners erbjuder vi en komplett livscykelhantering för klienter och mobila enheter, inklusive order och logistik, finansiering, asset management samt återtag av IT-utrustning. Vi hjälper våra medarbetare och kunder att använda utrustningen längre och säkerställer att enheter som inte har funktionalitet för att användas igen återvinns på ett miljövänligt och säkert sätt.
   

  

 I den här rollen kommer du att arbeta med såväl lagerhållning av hårdvaran samtidigt som du kommer sätta upp, installera och konfigurera kundens IT-komponenter. Du säkerställer också att avtalad utrustning följer med leveransen. I rollen ingår det också extra ansvar för inleveranser och returer. Löpande support arbete samt dokumentation och administration är naturliga inslag av arbetsuppgifter i din vardag. Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med ett härligt team med högt i tak och fantastisk laganda.
   

  

**Vad erbjuder vi dig på Iver?**
 Iver - Where technology meets business. Hos Iver får du möjlighet att arbeta med den senaste tekniken och vara med på en spännande tillväxtresa. Iver är ett bolag med entreprenöriella rötter och en kultur som präglas av flexibilitet och samarbete. Vårt mål är att våra kunder – här i Norden och internationellt – ska se oss som en ledande partner för digital transformation.
   

  

 På Iver är vi inkluderande och strävar efter genuint samarbete där vi arbetar mot gemensamma mål. Inom Iver finns stora möjligheter till utveckling och vi står bakom dig när du vill lära dig mer – inom ditt specialområde, ledarskap eller nya områden.
   

  

 Hos Iver är du också en del av ett ambitiöst och innovativt företag, vilket innebär att förbättra, testa, utvärdera och våga ändra hur vi gör saker är viktiga ingredienser och vi är övertygade om att det är så vi utvecklas. We’re not big blue. We’re yellow. Stora nog att skala och agila nog att innovera.
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 För att vara aktuellt för rollen så ser vi gärna att du har några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom relevant område. Vi ser gärna att du arbetat på lager tidigare, har du också erfarenhet inom IT är det meriterande. Vi söker någon som har ett intresse för IT och att utvecklas inom branschen. Du ska också vara duktig på dokumentation och administration som är en viktig del av arbetet. Därav behöver du vara flytande i det svenska och engelska språket i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 I rollen är det viktigt att säkerställa att vi paketerar, och administrerar rätt för varje kund och att du förstår vikten av god kommunikation Du är självgående i ditt arbete med fokus på effektivitet och noggrannhet men du också är en lagspelare och vet att det viktigaste är att teamet lyckas tillsammans.
   

  

**Placeringsort**
 Du kommer arbeta från vårt lager i Rotebro.
   

  

**Sök till oss!**
 Urval sker löpande, tjänsten kan tillsättas före sista ansökningsdag och vi ber om överseende för längre svarstid under sommarperioden. Iver eftersträvar en jämn könsfördelning och värdesätter etnisk och kulturell mångfald. Önskad start är snarast eller enligt överenskommelse. Under sommarperioden är du välkommen att kontakta våra rekryterare på ta@iver.se vid frågor eller funderingar kring tjänsten.
   

  

**Välkommen till Iver!**

title: Electronics engineer with experience in FPGA
description:
Join an exhilarating journey with a forward-thinking company that's revolutionizing DNA sequencing. As an Electronics engineer, you'll be an integral part of the development team, contributing to the design and implementation of their groundbreaking 3D DNA sequencer. Specifically, you will work on circuit board design and FPGA programming. Don't miss out – apply now and be part of this exciting opportunity! We apply ongoing selection.
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a Stockholm-based deep tech company aiming to transform the data generation in sequencing completely through their patented 3-D sequencing, a truly disruptive technology. They combine single molecule imaging, fiber optical gratings technologies and nano-fluidics to read DNA faster than anyone else.
 


  


 We are now seeking for an Electronincs engineer to become a part of their development team and contribute to the design and implementation of their 3D DNA sequencer. You will operate within a truly interdisciplinary environment, where various fields such as chemistry, mechanics, electronics, pneumatics, fluidics, optics, and software converge.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* To be part of a unique journey to create the next generation of DNA sequencing
  
* To work in an international and multidisciplinary team
  
* A long-term position with good development opportunities
  

  


**Work tasks**

 Your role will involve taking charge of the electronics components such as circuit board design and programming FGPA. You will collaborate in cross-functional teams, enjoying a high degree of freedom with responsibility.
 


  

  
* Design and development of digital systems. Utilize hardware description languages (HDL) such as VHDL and Verilog to create efficient and functional digital systems based on project specifications
  
* Simulation and verification
  
* Implementation and programming of FPGA
  
* Prototyping and testing
  
* Troubleshooting and problem-solving
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* Degree in electronics, mechatronics, embedded systems, or equivalent
  
* Experience in circuit board design
  
* Experience in FPGA programming
  
* Fluent in English
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  

  
* Goal oriented
  
* Orderly
  
* Responsible
  
* Intellectually curious
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Ida Pettersson or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106068

title: Area Sales Manager - Sweden
description:
***Paroc Panel System***
*is a major part of the* 
***Kingspan Group***
*. It is known worldwide for making great insulation and creative sandwich panels for roofs and building fronts. Founded in Ireland in 1965, Kingspan Group has grown a lot, making* 
***€8.3 billion***
*in sales. It has* 
***212 factories***
*in more than* 
***80 countries***
*and a team of* 
***24,000 happy workers.***
*We are dedicated to innovation, improvement, worldwide expansion, and environmental responsibility. Our high-tech products are suitable for both new buildings and renovation. Our team of* 
***20 specialists***
*in Sweden demonstrate our passion for exceptional quality.* 




  





**Role overview:** 




  





 We are looking for an experienced
 **Area Sales Manager** 
 who will manage and drive sales of our products of
 **Kingspan Insulated Panels and Paroc Panel System within Norr Stockholm area (Solna, Sundbyberg, Täby, Danderyd, Sollentuna, Järfälla, Upplands Väsby** 
 ). The goal is to develop strong customer relationships with our partners, oversee the sales process from lead generation to order delivery, and maintain a thorough knowledge of market trends and competitors to meet strategic and financial targets.
 



  





**Key responsibilities:** 




  




* Adapt the company sales strategy and financial plans for Nordic market
* Be aware of local laws that may affect the company and follow our main management system and company rules.
* Schedule regular meetings with managers to discuss performance and goals for the future
* Concentrate on increasing revenue by setting prices, negotiating with clients and looking for new opportunities
* Promptly managing potential projects, updating records and providing technical assistance in bidding.
* Follow up with customers after a sale to ensure customer satisfaction.
* Anticipate future sales. Inform management of any significant changes.
* Keep up-to-date with the activities of competitors and consider methods of staying ahead.
* Deal with customer complaint, offer to make things right, and find a solution everyone agrees



  





**Performance indicators:** 




  




* Growth in the project lead bank and the quote bank.
* Number of client visits and quality of client relationships.
* Orders received, revenue generated, and margins achieved.



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* A commercial or technical degree is preferred.
* At least 5 years' sales experience is required, preferably in related sectors.
* Good understanding of technology, business, finance, marketing, and sales.
* Working experience with CRM systems and knowledge of the sales process.
* Strong collaborative and teamworking skills
* Familiarity with design tools such as AutoCAD, Revu and IFC would be an advantage.
* Proficiency with MS Office, SAP, and CRM systems.
* Fluency in Swedish and English, with excellent written and oral communication skills is essential.
* You will be expected to visit customers and attend team meetings 2-3 days a week



  





**What we offer:** 




  




* Independent, exciting, and challenging tasks
* A supportive work environment with skilled and friendly colleagues
* Trainings and development opportunities
* Competitive renumeration structure
* Good pension scheme
* Company car
* Comprehensive personal insurance, health, vacation, and leisure insurance



  





*When you apply for a job on this site, the personal data contained in your application will be collected by Kingspan Insulated Panels Finland, which is located at* 
 Sysilahden teollisuusalue 2, 21600 Pargas, Finlandia
 *and can be contacted by emailing gdpr.nordics@kingspan.com.* 

*Your personal data will be processed for managing the Controller’s recruitment-related activities* 
***.***
*Such processing is legally permissible under Art. 6(1)(f) of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 (General Data Protection Regulation) as necessary for the legitimate interests pursued by the Controller, which are the solicitation, evaluation, and selection of applicants for employment.*

title: Business Solution Owner, Risk & Compliance
description:
TRATON Financial Services is the captive financial services provider of the TRATON Group. We strive to make sustainable transportation a reality through industry expertise, integrated solutions, and passionate people. TRATON Financial Services are currently in the beginning of our Transformation and our focus is to shape the future for TRATON Financial Services.
   

  

 Want to be part of our journey? We are now looking for a Risk and Compliance professional to join our team.
   

  

**The Opportunity**
 In the TRATON Financial Services IT & Digital (TGFI) team our mission is to work closely with all stakeholders to enable seamless delivery and assist the acceleration of new services provided to our markets all over the world. Here you will join skilled colleagues who enjoy having fun at work, in a dynamic work environment. You will get to collaborate globally and cross-functionally and interact with all levels of our organization, from management and committees to employees in various markets.
   

  

**About The Role**
 In this role, best described as a mix between a business analyst and product manager, you will report to our Head of UNITY Strategic Services. Your mission as the Business Solution Owner is to drive evolution and harmonization of processes and applications within your area of responsibility. You will select and support implementation of proper tools to ensure compliance in areas such as AML (Anti Money Laundering) in our markets across the world.
   

  

 As a Business Solution Owner, you will:
   

  

  

* Shape and lead the Risk & Compliance Community with, department heads, and local market stakeholders
* Act as a change agent, with focus on business processes
* Develop best practice by collaborating cross functionally
* Drive the Unity Risk & Compliance solution design by;
* Applying strategic direction of the business
* Identify and document market needs and business opportunities, converting them into clear requirements
* Working with test teams to ensure quality of deliverables and future regression testing capabilities
* Supporting application rollout to markets and common application set up
* Manage the scope of initiatives and projects
* Collaborating with other program resources to deliver on time and in budget
* Managing a backlog of future potential initiatives
* Document processes and routines for your area of responsibility


**About You**
 You have a can-do attitude and a pragmatic way of working. You can evaluate, prioritise, and act to build sustainable and robust solutions, that can evolve over time. As a collaborative team player, you confidently lead virtual teams and coordinate resources. You also have:
   

  

  

* Proven leadership skills to build confidence and drive change
* Experience from transformations within larger enterprises, including organisational changes
* Knowledge and experience with digital solutions for managing financial services requirements i.e., AML, GDPR, DORA (Digital Operational Resilience Act) etc.
* A good overall understanding of market needs and financial services
* Experience from working with outsourced solutions
* Excellent communication skills to build momentum and trust in processes and solutions
* Business Analytical skills
* Fluency in English (essential)
* Can-do attitude and adaptability to change


**We offer:**
* International contacts around the world
* Joining a global team of talented professionals
* Currently most of our employees are located in Södertälje, Sweden, Milton Keynes, UK and Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. We therefore can offer you to partly work from your location of choice


**Application**
 If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and make a significant impact in the world of TRATON Financial Services, we look forward to your application!
   

  

 Last day of application is September 12th. Please note that we do not accept applications by email. A background check will be conducted for this position.
   

  

**Additional Information**
 If you have any questions, please contact hiring manager Tom Brewin Head of UNITY Strategic Services, TRATON Financial Services:
   

  

 email : tom.brewin@tratonfs.com or telephone: +44(0)7836 652485.
   

  

**About The TRATON Group**
 TRATON is one of the world’s leading commercial vehicle manufacturers, consisting of the brands Scania, MAN, Volkswagen Caminhões e Ônibus, Navistar, and RIO. Through our products and services, and as a partner to our customers, we aim to transform transportation together. For us, sustainable economic growth always includes treating people and nature with respect. www.traton.com

title: Full Stack Engineer
description:
*Natural Cycles° is a leading women’s health company that developed the world’s first birth control app, used by millions globally. We are a fast growing startup, and we promote an international working environment filled with smart and ambitious colleagues based in Stockholm, Geneva, New York, and remotely. Our mission is to pioneer women’s health through research and passion, empowering every woman with the knowledge she needs to take charge of her health.* 




  





 We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Engineer (Payments) to join one of our product teams to focus on Payments. In this role you will focus on creating a smooth payment experience for our users and you will be a key player in the team focusing on payments. Together with the team you will drive the payment experience, shaping and managing our payment services from design, to implementation, deployment and maintenance, as we continue to scale. You’ll be expected to be comfortable working with other engineers and stakeholders to discover, plan, and execute on new features and improvements to our platform.
 



  





 We are looking for you whose soft skills shine and who can communicate with ease in English. You are passionate about technology, team work, but also have a responsibility and autonomy in your work. You are able to work efficiently in a remote work environment, in a setting where online and asynchronous communication is the foundation.
 



 Please note that we are hiring for this role in Sweden.
 



  





**What you will be doing** 



* Be part of a revenue-generating organization, drive online sales, and build an intuitive user experience to drive traffic and foster customer loyalty and retention
* Ship top-quality, performant, accessible, inclusive user interfaces, functionality and products.
* Work in an agile team together with other software engineers, product managers, designers & tester
* Work in close collaboration with stakeholders across the organization to deliver top-quality user interfaces and features
* Work hands-on with data insights and analytics, and always take the data driven approach
* Ensure continuous delivery of new releases while working in an agile way
* Maintain a healthy codebase



  





 Our technology stack includes:
 


* TypeScript, Node.js, Express.js running on GCP
* Ionic, Angular, Capacitor, React, Gatsby on the Frontend
* Python and Kotlin for Data science
* Highly automated CI pipelines (Github Actions)
* Multiple backend production deployments per day with <2% rollbacks (measured since 2019)
* AppStore/GooglePlay releases on a monthly basis
* Backend unit test coverage above 70% since 2019
* We ♥ Open Source, encourage Open Source contributions and often open our general-purpose repositories.



  





**What skills and experience we think you have** 



* Experience in Backend and Frontend development alike.
* Experience with modern TypeScript, JavaScript, Node.js in production.
* Experience working with 3rd party integrations and payment systems
* Creative and pragmatic approach to problem solving with the ability to focus on details while maintaining the “big picture” view
* Great communication skills and ability to explain complex, technical solutions to both technical and non-technical team members
* Organized and detail oriented



  





 Not required but it would be a bonus if you also have:
 


* Project management experience
* Experience working with subscriptions
* Commercial acumen and understanding of business drivers



  





**What we offer** 



* Flexible work arrangement - you will be part of a team based in and around Stockholm that values effective collaboration and transparent communication, irrespective of work location
* Professional development - you will collaborate with industry leading developers, promoting continuous growth and skill enhancement
* Modern technology - you will leverage innovative technologies and tools, within an environment that empowers you to contribute ideas and take ownership of your work
* Impactful projects - you will contribute to groundbreaking projects that redefine industry standards and create tangible value
* Commitment to quality - you will join a dynamic and progressive organization that prioritizes profitable, long-term product development



  





**Location** 




 We are remote-friendly, but we find great value in being able to connect with our teams in person. Most of the product development team you will work with is located in Stockholm.
 



  





**Sounds interesting?** 




 If you want to be part of a successful team, we encourage you to apply for this position as soon as possible.
 



 We look forward to hearing from you!
 



  





**How to apply** 




 To apply, just upload your CV and answer the questions on the application form. Keep in mind that we can't accept applications through email because of GDPR, and only applications submitted via the career site (and in English) will be considered.
 



  





 At Natural Cycles we value diversity and inclusion because we know that teams with people from different backgrounds and experiences are stronger. We welcome candidates from all walks of life and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and candidates.

title: Lead GPU Software Engineer to Mycronic!
description:
Think of the most high-tech electronics products you can imagine. Then think one step further. What technology creates the most advanced high-tech of today? Mycronic´s do. With unique and world-leading production solutions, they spearhead the electronics industry. Right now, Mycronic are on a journey of growth, where they continue to explore new markets and expand worldwide and we need to strengthen the software area with GPU competence. Do you have experience in GPU and parallel programming and wants to take the lead within this area? Then you have come to the right place. Read on!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**Company :**
 Mycronic AB (publ)
 



  

**City :**
 Täby
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 According to agreement
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Recruitment
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Mycronic is a Swedish high-tech company and has been a trusted partner to electronics and display manufacturers worldwide forover 40 years. They are headquartered in Stockholm, Täby and with subsidiaries, agents and distributors in more than 50 countries. From the very beginning, when Mycronic introduced the world’s first laser-based mask writer, their innovations have been driven by two main sources, their customers and their employees. Currently, there is no other company in the entire world that can compete with Mycronic's technology. All high-resolution screens you see, whether it's a TV, phone, tablet, Apple Watch, etc., they are made with Mycronic’s machines, and this is the technology you will work with. You will work at the very forefront of the electronics industry and work in a mixed team with both junior and experienced developers in C++, Java and C. In addition to your closest team, you will also collaborate in cross-disciplinary projects with engineers in electronics, mechatronics, mechanics, optics and lithography and work together to find the best solutions!
 


  


  

**A few words from one of the Software Group Managers at Mycronic**



  


 " You will face the challenges that are on the cutting edge of todays technology when it comes to parallel processing and GPU accelerated computation. Mycronic is a warm and innovative company fostering an inclusive and diverse culture and we always welcome great minds that think alike 😊”
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* Freedom with responsibility and an opportunity to really make a difference with your competence within GPU
  
* An opportunity to work with the entire development process from gathering requirements to concept, development and testing.
  
* You will be part of a company with a diverse culture and workforce. To Mycronic, diversity is not only a key competitive advantage, but also the very foundation for a great place to work and innovation to happen.
  
* Not only nice colleagues but also high levels of expertise - you will find yourself side by side with some of the leading experts in the electronics industry, getting inspired and inspiring others, as you acquire new knowledge and share it with others across functions and cultures.
  


  


  

**Bringing tomorrow's electronics to life.**



  

  


  

**Work tasks**



  


 The PG (Pattern Generator) division you will belong to has a software organization of 60 employees divided into 7 teams where you will belong to one of them. The role as GPU Software Engineer is new as GPU is a relatively new area for Mycronic that they will heavily invest in the coming years. The goal is to be able to process data even faster and thus deliver more value to their customers. You will be an important part of the work to maximize performance and ensure that you get as much as possible out of the hardware but also to make the product as user-friendly as possible. You will work with the entire development process from start to end and collaborate closely with your colleagues where your ideas will both be appreciated and highlighted and together, you enable tomorrow's electronics production.
   

 Furthermore you will..
 


  

  
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement GPU-accelerated algorithms and applications.
  
* Optimize existing software for GPU architectures to maximize performance and efficiency.
  
* Conduct research and development to explore new techniques and technologies in GPU computing.
  
* Perform code reviews, testing, and debugging to ensure high-quality deliverables.
  
* Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in GPU technology and CUDA programming.
  

  


**We are looking for**

 In this recruitment, we will place great emphasis on your personal qualities and interest in Mycronic as a company and this specific position. Empazise in your application why you are interested.
 


  


 Furthermore, you have…
 


  

  
* At least a bachelor's degree in computer technology, electronics or similar
  
* Several years of experience in the field
  
* Strong knowledge in CUDA programming and GPU architecture
  
* An understand of parallel programming
  
* Knowledge in C/C++
  


  


 We see it as a merit if you have…
 


  

  
* Knowledge in OpenCL or Vulkan
  
* Knowledge in TensorFlow or PyTorch
  
* Knowledge in OpenGL, DirectX or similar
  


  


  

**Other information**



  

  
* Start: According to agreement
  
* Work extent: Full-time
  
* Location: Täby, possibility to work from home a couple of days a week
  
* Contact details: Johanna Sörell, Senior Recruitment Consultant, johanna.sorell@academicwork.se
  
* This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and the request from Mycronic is that all questions about the recruitment process goes to Academic Work. Apply through Academic Works website.
   

 ·
  


  


  

**The recruitment process**



  

  
* Phone interview with Academic Work
  
* Teams interview with Academic Work, personality test + problem solving test
  
* Interviews with Mycronic
  
* Reference checking + decision
  


  

  

  

  

  

**Mycronic AB (publ)**

 Read more about Mycronic on their website: https://www.mycronic.com/​
   




**Get directly recruited to Mycronic AB (publ)**

 When you apply to this application, you will get hired by our partner. This means that you can relax while we take care of the application process.
   




**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Johanna Sörell or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on stn05@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15105420

title: Affärsstöd
description:
**Älskar du att samarbeta och beskrivs som en ”doer”? Motiveras du av att stötta dina kollegor? Tveka inte att söka jobbet.** 




 Inför hösten letar vi efter en ny kollega att göra oss sällskap och utveckla regionens företag tillsammans med oss! Almi investerar i framtida hållbar tillväxt - med lån, riskkapital och affärsutveckling skapar vi möjlighet för företag att växa och utvecklas. Vi kan företagande och brinner för att våra kunder ska lyckas i sina ambitioner med att starta eller utveckla sina redan etablerade affärer och fortsatt växa hållbart.
 



  





**Rollen** 




 I rollen som affärsstöd kommer du ha förståelse för hela Almis uppdrag och erbjudande. Din roll är bred och ditt primära fokus är att stötta där det behövs, i stort som smått. Vår vardag består av strukturerade möten med kunder/företagare, kreditgivningsprocesser samt marknads- och kommunikationsarbete i syfte att attrahera nya kunder.
 



  





 Som en del av vårt team kommer du att stötta rådgivarna och cheferna i administrativa arbetsuppgifter.
 



  





 Du kommer även att vara vår viktiga röst när företagare ringer in till oss via kundtjänst.
 



 Du blir en viktig kugge i att vår dagliga verksamhet fungerar smidigt och bidrar därmed till att skapa värde för våra kunder. I denna roll förväntas du till stor del vara på plats på kontoret.
 



  





**Vem är du?** 




 För att lyckas i rollen krävs att du är strukturerad och bra på att få saker gjorda.
 



 Du trivs med att ha många olika kontaktytor och att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt. Du är drivande och lösningsorienterad.
 



  





 Vidare har du en god kommunikativ förmåga och kan växla mellan administrativa och mer praktiska uppgifter. God IT-vana är en förutsättning och du kan med lätthet lära dig nya system.
 



 För att trivas på Almi behöver man vara prestigelös och samarbetsvillig med ett stort mått av nyfikenhet.
 



  





 Vi tror att du har haft administrativa roller tidigare med ett gott ”track record” men du kan också ha en annan passande bakgrund.
 



  





 Det viktigaste är dock att du är en lösningsorienterad ”doer” som både ser och hör saker som du sedan har förmågan att agera på.
 



  





**Placeringsort** 




 Placering på vårt kontor i centrala Stockholm, precis vid Centralstationen.
 



 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning med provanställning på 6 månader.
 



  





**Ansökan** 




 Urval sker löpande varför vi önskar din ansökan snarast, dock senast den 23 augusti 2024. Din ansökan och CV skickar du in via vårt rekryteringssystem GradeVarbi.
 



  





 En bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidaten.
 



  





**Att arbeta på Almi** 




 På Almi är kompetens, samhällsengagemanget och affärsmässigheten en viktig drivkraft. Det finns ett starkt gemensamt intresse – att se fler växande och framgångsrika företag i Sverige. För att trivas hos Almi stimuleras du därför av att tillsammans med dina kollegor arbeta för andra människors framgång och för ett hållbart företagande. Arbetsmiljön präglas av glädje och stort engagemang där vi värdesätter modet att tänka nytt.
 



  





 På Almi värdesätter vi olikheter, varav vi driver ett aktivt mångfaldsarbete både internt och externt och tror på att medarbetarnas olika bakgrunder, erfarenheter, kunskaper och personligheter berikar verksamheten. I rekryteringssammanhang är fokus på mångfald utifrån exempelvis kön, ålder, och utländsk bakgrund en självklarhet.
 



  





 Vill du ha ett uppdrag som påverkar, ett jobb som engagerar och allt detta på en arbetsplats som inspirerar - kom till Almi!
 



  





 En bakgrundskontroll genomförs på slutkandidat vid tillsättning.

title: Sales Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 Checkout.com is one of the most exciting fintechs in the world. Our mission is to enable businesses and their communities to thrive in the digital economy. We’re the strategic payments partner for some of the best known fast-moving brands globally such as Wise, Hut Group, Sony Electronics, Homebase, Henkel, Klarna and many others. Purpose-built with performance and scalability in mind, our flexible cloud-based payments platform helps global enterprises launch new products and create experiences customers love. And it's not just what we build that makes us different. It's how.
   

  

 We empower passionate problem-solvers to collaborate, innovate and do their best work. That’s why we’re on the Forbes Cloud 100 list and a Great Place to Work accredited company. And we’re just getting started. We’re building diverse and inclusive teams around the world — because that’s how we create even better experiences for our merchants and our partners. And we need your help. Join us to build the digital economy of tomorrow.
   

  

**Job Description**
**The role**
 Checkout.com are actively looking for an enthusiastic and talented Sales Manager to join our Commercial Team in Stockholm, to drive rapid growth across various industries for our revolutionary online payment solution.
   

  

 If you are a driven and focused salesperson with a proven track record of selling cutting edge payment solutions in a high-growth and competitive environment, this is the role for you. In return, on top of a tremendous working environment, we offer you an unrivalled uncapped recurring commissions plan!
   

  

 Reporting to the Director, the Sales Manager in the Nordics will handle multiple sales cycles, always ensuring a high conversion rate and outperforming the sales targets.
   

  

 Along the way, you'll collaborate closely with various in-house talents across Technology and Business to position our capabilities, products, services and solutions effectively with prospects. The ideal candidate will need to be an independent, high-achieving individual, able to stand out in an entrepreneurial environment and outperform sales targets through personal drive.
   

  

**How You’ll Make An Impact**
* Identify the most promising merchants and prospects that will help Checkout.com grow a healthy pipeline across various verticals.
* Sell our new cross-borders payment solutions and services to eCommerce merchants through cold calling, networking, fairs etc.
* Help new merchants evaluate Checkout.com and handle detailed questions about our product capabilities.
* Prepare thorough presentations and proposals for prospective merchants.
* Orchestrate the entire Sales process and act as the main point of contact for merchants and internal stakeholders.
* Maintain a solid, well-organized portfolio and nurture key accounts.
* Partner with other Sales Managers to share best practices, key business insights and industry trends.


**Qualifications**
**What we’re looking for**
* 3+ years Sales experience in the Payments industry.
* Solid network of potential prospects and partners in the Nordics.
* Excellent knowledge of Salesforce.
* Tech-savvy, with a passion for Technology.
* Solid business acumen and awareness of financial factors.
* Exceptional communication, negotiation skills and techniques.
* Highly organized and able to prioritize shifting workloads and responsibilities effectively.


**Additional Information**
**Apply without meeting all requirements statement**
 If you don't meet all the requirements but think you might still be right for the role, please apply anyway. We're always keen to speak to people who connect with our mission and values.
   

  

**We believe in equal opportunities**
 We work as one team. Wherever you come from. However you identify. And whichever payment method you use.
   

  

 Our clients come from all over the world — and so do we. Hiring hard-working people and giving them a community to thrive in is critical to our success.
   

  

 When you join our team, we’ll empower you to unlock your potential so you can do your best work. We’d love to hear how you think you could make a difference here with us.
   

  

 We want to set you up for success and make our process as accessible as possible. So let us know in your application, or tell your recruiter directly, if you need anything to make your experience or working environment more comfortable. We’ll be happy to support you.
   

  

**Take a peek inside life at Checkout.com via**
* Our Culture video https://youtu.be/BEwnpHuadSw
* Our careers page https://www.checkout.com/careers
* Our LinkedIn Life pages bit.ly/3OaoN1U
* Our Instagram https://www.instagram.com/checkout\_com/

title: Operational Excellence Expert
description:
**Job ID: 24028** 
  
   

  

 Are you our new Operational Excellence Expert? In Operational Excellence, part of KYC Process Excellence, we manage and develop the OX methodology and support with the implementation of it within the KYC Service Lines. We enable and initiate sustainable Continuous Improvement activities leading to great customer experiences and improved efficiency in Nordea Operations.
 





  

  



 At Nordea, we see that the world is changing fast – and we want to be one step ahead of the curve. That’s why we’re deeply committed to providing the financial solutions of tomorrow to our customers. We’re creating an agile environment where we experiment and grow together – and we need your ideas and unique background. With us, you’ll be in good company with a chance to make your mark on something bigger. 
   

  





**About this opportunity**




 Welcome to the Operational Process Management Team 1 team. As the Operational Excellence Expert (Temporary position) / GFCP Expert, you’ll play a will play a key role in shaping the way Operational Excellence as a capability is further implemented and developed in KYC Services.
   

  

**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Acting as a coach and OX training partner for our Operational Service lines
* Supporting Operational Service lines in planning and driving performance improvements that will have substantial impact on the business results
* Proactively seeking improvement opportunities in our ways of working
* Facilitating Kaizen events and other improvement initiatives
* Catalysing improvement culture by sharing, implementing, and sustaining best practices across different service lines
* Analysing numerical and verbal data and other sources of information and constantly find ways how to improve our business
* Acting as a SME for LEAN OX and contribute to the Operational Excellence capability development



  

  



 You’ll join a fun, collaborative and dynamic team with great atmosphere. Our team consists of experts from different Nordic locations, Estonia and Poland. This is a temporary parental leave cover until August 2025.
   

  





**Who you are**




 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  
   

  

**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Demonstrate ability to coach and mentor individuals on their personal transformation to Operational Excellence
* Are able to collaborate with individuals at all levels within the organization
* Are able to plan and drive OX initiatives independently
* Have the right mindset and knowhow to participate in continuous process improvement efforts (ex. Lean, Six Sigma, Agile)
* Have professional level English-language written and oral communication skills, organizational and time management skills
* Have passion for improvements and self-development – everything is learning
* Are comfortable giving and receiving feedback
* Are able to initiate and generate action, but you are also mastering the deployment and follow-up steps in order to secure successful and sustainable change
* Possess strong skills in Microsoft Office tools. Experience of using Power BI is a plus



  

  



**Your experience and background:** 





* Recommended certifications: LSSGB / LSSBB or Internal Nordea OX certifications (apprentice level)
* Desired proficiency with basic statistical analysis and change management techniques:
 

	+ Ability to utilise basic statistical analysis (average, standard deviation, charts: bar, pie, run, Pareto etc.)
	+ Workshop facilitation skills (also remote/virtual) and fluency in managing communication to various stakeholders as a part of change management process
* Relevant working experience in LEAN/OX area



  
 





**What we offer:** 





* Comprehensive onboarding to your new job
* Opportunity to make a difference while driving efficiency in KYC Services processes
* Flexible working –we are using hybrid model
* Personalized career paths and Leaders who will guide and support you in your development
* Opportunity to build your network with stakeholders across GFCP and the bank as a whole
* Global team collaborating in a multicultural environment
* ‘Great team atmosphere’ is not only a catchline, you will be welcomed to a team with a great spirit



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps**




 Submit your application no later than
 



 27/08/2024
 



 . 
   

  

 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





 Please be aware that any applications or CVs coming through email or direct messages will not be accepted or considered.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden** 
 : For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Finland:** 
 A security clearance will be performed for the person selected for this position.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
  Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.

title: Senior Product Manager - Console
description:
*Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.*
 The Customer Experience area at Tink has a clear mission: to deliver world-class product experiences for our customers. We are a tightly-knit team with a mixture of skills such as product and engineering managers, full stack engineers, designers, data analysts and copywriters. By solving the right problem, crafting a scalable solution, and providing great experiences, we ensure our customers see value from the Tink platform from day one.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to oversee the development of the Tink Console, a web-based application that lets developers configure, manage, test and deploy access to our portfolio of API-based products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Use your deep understanding of developer platforms to deliver powerful, yet delightfully simple tools that elevate the customer experience.
* Collaborate closely with other Tink product teams to constantly improve how their products are packaged, presented and delivered to their users. Articulating and delivering a vision that encompasses multiple products is a crucial part of your role.
* Develop, through stakeholder collaboration, a cohesive vision for how Tink customers should experience working with Tink's products.Establish a structure to optimize the performance of the teams and area over the long term.
* This position plays a key role in enhancing Tink's overall Product Management expertise.
* Ensure high performance and tight collaboration within teams.
* Management and mentorship of product experts for their growth is also part of the role.
* Structuring domain targets and ensuring their achievement is a key responsibility.


**What We Offer You**
 Tink offers you a dynamic work environment where you can grow and develop your skills, with opportunities for career advancement. You will have the chance to oversee and shape the future of our product, and be part of a mission to deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers.
   

  

**What We’re Looking For**
 We are looking for a senior product leader who can be the domain expert and fully understand all aspects of our products. You should be able to articulate goals and objectives that encompass multiple products and deliver this vision through multiple teams. We expect you to manage and structure customer-facing collaborations, ensure tight collaboration and high performance within teams, and manage and mentor more product experts for growth.
   

  

**We Would Like You To Have**
* Significant product management experience at a technology company, creating strategic product roadmap(s) from conception to launch while working with cross-functional teams.
* A keen interest in software development, perhaps you’ve worked as a software engineer yourself.
* Previous experience working with developer-first platforms and portals is a plus.
* Exceptional product discovery, decision-making, and delivery skills.
* Strong collaboration, people and team development skills.


 This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office 2-3 days a week (determined by leadership/site), with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% or more of the time based on business needs.
   

  

*Who we are at Tink*
*We are a company of developers and engineers – it’s in our DNA to imagine, build and iterate. We were founded with a vision of transforming an industry that lacked competition and momentum. And we have built a company of passionate over-achievers who all believe there is always a better way of doing things.*
*People from all over Europe – and the world – have joined us on our mission to build the biggest and best open banking platform in Europe.*
*We're looking forward to your application!*
 Tink was founded in 2012, and a decade later became part of Visa in 2022. Tink was created with the aim of changing the banking industry for the better. We have built Europe’s most robust open banking platform – with the broadest, deepest connectivity and powerful services that create value out of the financial data. We offer the tools that allow anyone – from big banks and fintechs to startups – to build the future of financial services across Europe.
   

  

 Tink’s 500+ employees serve more than 300 banks and fintechs in 18 European markets, out of offices in 13 countries. We power the new world of finance. For more information, visit tink.com.

title: DevSecOps SRE Engineer
description:
Join our Team
   

  

**About This Opportunity**
 As the tech firm that crafted the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, Ericsson has made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, crafting the future of technology. This is a place where you're encouraged as your own perfectly outstanding self, and celebrated for the skills, talent, and perspective you bring to the team.
   

  

 As a key member of Ericsson's Sapper Operational team, the Operations Strategy and Customer Experience Lead will play a pivotal role in shaping the future of BCSS's evolved cloud-native portfolio as well as exploring new ways of building and delivering solutions, including enabling cloud native “as a Service” offerings.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
 In the Sapper SRE team, you will be responsible for the physical and logical connectivity when onboarding new customers, specifically establishing the network connectivity by connecting Sapper customers' IT/Telcom systems and infrastructure with Sappers’ CNaaS, which is running in a Hyperscale Cloud Provider, delivered as a SaaS offering.
   

  

 This role demands a good understanding of both on-premises and cloud hardware, such as network switches and routers and cloud technologies, guaranteeing seamless security, data protection and reliability from end-to-end deployment and delivery perspective. In a fast-changing innovative environment, with a DevSecOps/Service Reliability Engineering mindset, you will find fulfillment in successfully implementing new cloud-native services and delighting new customers by making it very easy for them.
   

  

 Responsibilities:
   

  

* Deploy on-premise and cloud infrastructure for our “as a service” customer's IT/Telcom systems and infrastructure.
* Manage the scope, cost, and oversee the physical installation and configuration of hardware like routers, switches, or firewalls at customer locations.
* Scope, procure, and facilitate the installation and configuration of hardware physically like routers, switches, or firewalls in each customer deployment together with professional installation partners and/or the customer’s teams.
* Test and validate installations for proper functionality before training and going live.
* Collaborate cross-functionally both internally and externally to drive network installation and configuration to successful completion.
* Efficiently manage multiple external vendors such and stakeholders to meet implementation requirements within specified timelines.
* Guide key stakeholders through the implementation lifecycle to ensure the successful deployment of our Sapper CNaaS.
* Proactively identify implementation risks and implement efficient mitigation strategies to safeguard project success.
* Help identify areas where the team can build in automation, and powered by Big Data, Machine Learning (ML)/ AI, including Large Language Models, to convert manual steps to a Connectivity-as-a-Service offering.


**The Skills You Bring**
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Technology, Telecommunications, Computer Science, or a related field is preferred.


- 1+ years of experience in traditional telecom networking including routers, firewalls, IP SEC, IP routing protocols and methods

- 1+ years of experience in hybrid-cloud technologies, architectures, networking, and cloud-based systems within the telecom industry.

- Proven Hands-on experience with Google Cloud Platform (GCP)in customer interfacing deployment and setup infrastructure with a strong focus on delivering exceptional service.

- Additional expertise in:

* Leveraging Google Cloud, which enables access to Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) networks and Compute Engine virtual machine (VM) instances from on-premises networks or other cloud providers.
* Connecting sites through a Network Connectivity Center hub located in the HCP locations.
* Utilizing HCP Workspace and supported APIs, facilitating access to specific products and services.
* Interacting with CDN(content delivery network)(Cloudflare) providers, allowing the selection of supported content delivery providers with Direct Peering links to HCP’s edge network, enabling traffic routing from VPC networks.
* Identity as a Service (IDaaS) working knowledge for identity services and endpoint administration for HCP
* Working, hands on knowledge of various firewalls and other cloud-managed security network architectures
* Understanding and experience with the Application Landing Zones concept Internet-facing, Internet first, Cloud Native, and Zero Trust
* Understanding and experience with Corporate Network Connectivity and firewalls setups
* Understanding Cloudflare’s SSE & SASE Platform and Composable Zero Trust networking with a connectivity cloud (Global Identity Aware Proxy)
* Extra plus is an understanding of Ericsson’s central service for Identity Management and access provisioning, EGAD (Ericsson Global Active Directory) and XEAD (eXternal Ericsson Active Directory) which is based on Active Domain Directory Services.


**Why join Solution Area Sapper**
 Ericsson Cloud Software & Services (BCSS) continues to evolve cloud native portfolio as well as explores new ways of building solutions, including enabling cloud native “as a Service” offerings. The newly established Sapper unit will ensure BCSS readiness for “as a Service” when our customers start shifting towards new networks operations models that could truly maximise the opportunities and agility cloud native deployment brings. We have chosen less traditional name for our newly acceleration unit to signal that this unit will operate differently. The name Sapper originates from a soldier that performs challenging tasks that require engineering skills, a pioneer with deep technical understanding.
   

  

 With us, you will have an outstanding opportunity: The chance to use your skills and creativity to push the boundaries of what is possible. To build never seen before solutions to some of the world’s toughest problems.
   

  

**What happens once you apply?**
 Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.
   

  

 We encourage you to consider applying to jobs where you might not meet all the criteria. We recognize that we all have transferrable skills, and we can support you with the skills that you need to develop.
   

  

 Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer, learn more.
   

  

**Primary country and city:** 
 Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
   

  

**Job details:** 
 Developer
   

  

**Job Stage:** 
 Job Stage 5
   

  

**Primary Recruiter:** 
 Sofia Kolbovich
   

  

**Hiring Manager:** 
 Christopher Blackwood
   

  

 ]]>

title: Kundtjänstmedarbetare deltid
description:
Lendo, part of Lendo Group, is a leading marketplace for loans. On our marketplace people seek guidance, browse, get and manage consumer loans, car loans, credit cards, business loans and mortgages. Today we operate in Scandinavia including 250+ employees working each day to empower people to make smart financial decisions that actually make a difference in their lives. Since our humble beginning back in 2007, we have helped thousands of people get a fair price on loans, get in control and let the lenders compete for their business.
   

  

 Since the launch, we have worked hard to make the market for loans more transparent and digital. After the success in Sweden, we expanded into the Scandinavian countries of Norway and Denmark.
   

  

 Since 2009 Lendo is also a part of the Schibsted family of brands.
   

  

 Lendo has always been about helping people keep control over their personal finances and lenders finding quality customers. As a leader in our category, we have made it easier for people to get a fair price on loans, often reducing their interest substantially.
   

  

 We believe in a market built on trust and transparency. This is why we strive for openness between our customers and partners.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Vi på Lendo söker nu en ny kollega för en deltidsroll inom kundtjänst!**
 Är du redo för en ny utmaning och älskar service? Nu söker vi efter en stjärna som brinner för kundnöjdhet och service av världsklass.
   

  

**Om bolaget**
 Lendo är ett fintechbolag inom Schibstedkoncernen sedan 2009 som erbjuder mäklartjänster på kreditmarknaden. Bolaget är Sveriges största jämförelsetjänst för lån. Lendos mål är att bidra till en transparentare lånemarknad där kund får insyn i marknadens olika låneerbjudanden, om du är i behov av ett privat, bo- eller företagslån.
   

  

**Rollen**
 I rollen som kundservicemedarbetare hos Lendo kommer du att spela en central roll och ingå i ett team på 15 personer som tillsammans ansvarar för Lendos kundsupport. Du hjälper Lendos kunder med olika frågor via telefon, chatt och mejl. Du hanterar bland annat ansökningar utifrån kundens behov och situation och har daglig kontakt med samarbetspartners.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Kanske är du student och söker en deltidsroll vid sidan av dina studier?
   

  

 Vi tror att du är en relationsskapande person som älskar att ha kontakt med kunder, kollegor och samarbetspartners. Du har tidigare arbetat i en roll som innefattat telefonkontakt med kunder, det är även ett plus om du hanterat ärenden administrativt. Som person är du lösningsorienterad, initiativtagande och positiv samt trivs i en dynamisk och föränderlig roll och organisation. Du är en teamplayer som tycker om att arbeta i grupp. Vidare är du kommunikativ, ansvarstagande och serviceinriktad. Du har en stark ambition att vilja utvecklas med företaget, såväl på individnivå som gruppnivå och kommer gärna med lösnings- och förbättringsförslag.
   

  

**Din profil**
* Gymnasieexamen, gärna inriktning mot ekonomi eller liknande
* Har erfarenhet från arbete i kundtjänst via telefon
* Talar och skriver svenska och engelska flytande
* Är serviceinriktad
* Du gillar att jobba enligt tydliga mål
* God dator- och systemvana


**Upplägg**
 Vi söker en person med flexibel inställning till arbetstider. Vårt primära behov är varierande mellan måndag-torsdag kl. 16-20 samt lördagar och söndagar kl. 10-14. Arbetstiderna bestäms i samråd med närmsta chef. Du förväntas arbeta 12 timmar per vecka, och tillgänglighet för extraarbete under semestertider, inklusive sommar- och julledighet, är nödvändigt.
   

  

 Detta är en deltidstjänst med placering i centrala Stockholm men man har också möjlighet att kombinera det med arbete på distans. Upplärningsprocessen utgår från kontoret under en period på 4 veckor under dagtid.
   

  

**Start**
 Enligt överenskommelse.
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Rekrytering sker löpande och urval- och intervjuprocess kommer att påbörjas omgående så tveka inte att visa ditt intresse redan idag så kommer vi att höra av oss om din profil matchar kravprofilen. Vid frågor om rollen är du välkommen att kontakta Victoria Ramirez, ansvarig rekryterare, på victoria.ramirez@schibsted.com.
   

  

 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: IPT Analyst (Temp)
description:
At Cepheid, we are passionate about improving health care through fast, accurate diagnostic testing. Our mission drives us, every moment of every day, as we develop scalable, groundbreaking solutions to solve the world’s most complex health challenges. Our associates are involved in every stage of molecular diagnostics, from ideation to development and delivery of testing advancements that improve patient outcomes across a range of settings. As a member of our team, you can make an immediate, measurable impact on a global scale, within an environment that fosters career growth and development.
   

  

 Cepheid is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Danaher Diagnostics companies. Together, we’re working at the pace of change on diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges, driven by knowing that behind every test there is a patient waiting.
   

  

 Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.
   

  

 The In Process Testing Analyst is responsible for performing in process testing of our PCR products produced on our automated assembly lines to ensure patient safety. The results from performed tests are compiled and transferred to documents, programs, and databases.
   

  

 The work environment in the IPT lab is very dynamic, and you will work in a team of 9 high performing analysts.
   

  

 The role works
 **5-shifts** 
 meaning that you will work a total of 19 shifts in a continuous schedule of 5 weeks. The shifts include 5 day shifts, 5 evening shifts, 5 night shifts and 4 week-end shifts (2 daytime and 2 night time) with several days of rest in between the change from day/evening/night shifts.
   

  

 Are you quality oriented and have a passion for laboratory work? Then you might be the one that we are looking for! Cepheid is a fast-growing company and the Solna site offers great development opportunities within quality, R&D, engineering, project management and people management.
   

  

 This position is part of the quality organization (Product Quality Control) and will be located in Solna, Stockholm, Sweden. At Cepheid, our vision is to be the leading provider of seamlessly connected diagnostic solutions.
   

  

**In this role, you will have the opportunity to:**
* Develop and implement testing, sampling and inspection procedures on raw materials, equipment, in-process materials, and/or finished products in the lab.
* Ensure that product specifications and company / regulatory requirements are met.
* Investigate and troubleshoot functionality and performance problems.
* Recommends corrective action when appropriate.
* Monitor and execute on-site equipment and tools calibration.


**The essential requirements of the job include:**
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree within Life Science or related with 0 years of experience.


 OR
   

  

* High School degree (or equivalent experience) with 2-4 years of related work experience or Technical Trade Degree with 1-2 years of work experience within laboratory work or related industry
* Fluent level of Swedish and English


 Cepheid, a Danaher operating company, offers a broad array of comprehensive, competitive benefit programs that add value to our lives. Whether it’s a health care program or paid time off, our programs contribute to life beyond the job. Check out our benefits at danaherbenefitsinfo.com.
   

  

 At Danaher we bring together science, technology and operational capabilities to accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life. Our global teams are pioneering what’s next across Life Sciences, Diagnostics, Biotechnology and beyond. For more information, visit www.danaher.com.
   

  

 At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.

title: Food & Beverage Team Member
description:
**Hilton Stockholm Slussen is now looking for a part-time (75%) team member to join our team in our Panorama restaurant. In Panorama we cater to all our breakfast and conference guests. You will join an international organization with the possibility of an international career. Hilton is a global leading hotel company with over 7000 hotels in more than 100 countries. Hilton Stockholm Slussen is located with a view over the old town. In addition to the 289 guest rooms and large meeting & event facilities, we operate a bar and restaurants.**
**What will I be doing?**
 As a team member, you are responsible for serving guests in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner to deliver an excellent Guest and Member experience. A team member will also be required to have extensive knowledge of menu offerings. Specifically, you will be responsible for performing the following tasks to the highest standards:
   

  

* Manage guest queries in a friendly, timely, and efficient manner
* Serve Alcoholic/non-Alcoholic beverages in conjunction with licensing/liquor regulations for residents and non-residents
* Ensure knowledge of menu and all products
* Ensure mis-en-place is well stocked at all floor stations
* Follow correct reporting procedures if faced with issues
* Ensure Food and Beverage orders are of a consistently good standard and delivered in a timely manor
* Practice Hilton Grooming standards including uniform dress code, cleanliness and personal hygiene
* Comply with hotel security, fire regulations and all health and safety legislation


**What are we looking for?**
 A team member serving Hilton brands is always working on behalf of our Guests and working with other Team Members. To successfully fill this role, you should maintain the attitude, behaviours, skills, and values that follow:
   

  

* Positive attitude
* Good communication skills
* Committed to delivering high levels of customer service
* Excellent grooming standards
* Flexibility to respond to a range of different work situations
* Ability to work on your own or in teams


 It would be advantageous in this position for you to demonstrate the following capabilities and distinctions:
   

  

* Experience in Food and Beverage department and/or industry
* Previous experience of conference department
* Knowledge of Food Hygiene Regulations


**What will it be like to work for Hilton?**
 Hilton is the leading global hospitality company, spanning the lodging sector from luxurious full-service hotels and resorts to extended-stay suites and mid-priced hotels. For over a century, Hilton has offered business and leisure travellers the finest in accommodations, service, amenities and value. Hilton is dedicated to continuing its tradition of providing exceptional guest experiences across its global brands. Our vision “to fill the earth with the light and warmth of hospitality” unites us as a team to create remarkable hospitality experiences around the world every day.
   

  

 Our amazing Team Members are at the heart of it all! Thrive at Hilton is our Team Member Value Proposition. It supports the well-being and performance of our Team Members with industry-leading benefits, recognition and support to meet your professional needs. We are committed to creating a diverse environment where every team member can thrive and be their authentic self.
   

  

 Hilton Stockholm Slussen is certified a Great Place to Work Sweden, as the only hospitality company for our great culture, benefits and team member engagement.
   

  

 As a Hilton team member, you will enjoy access to GO Hilton, team member travel program with discounted rates at hotels all over our beautiful world.
   

  

 Other team member benefits offered at Hilton and Hilton Stockholm Slussen includes:
   

  

* Hilton University courses including development programs, such as Harvard.
* Access to ComPsych Employee Assistance Program with free local counselling for mental wellness, family and other personal problem as well as support with financial advice.
* Local health insurance.
* Local pension benefits.
* Free access to the local gym.
* Parental Pay.


**Work Locations**
 Hilton Stockholm Slussen Hotel
   

  

**Schedule**
 Part-time
   

  

**Brand**
 Hilton Hotels & Resorts
   

  

**Job**
 Bars and Restaurants

title: Senior Frontend Engineer (React & React Native)
description:
**About The Role**
 We are looking for a passionate
 **Senior Frontend Engineer** 
 with experience working in
 **React, React Native, JavaScript and Typescript** 
 . As a member of a Cross-Functional team within the Payments Area, you'll be responsible for designing and implementing the user interface of our web applications and integrating against the back end via REST APIs. You'll also be collaborating closely with Product Owner, other front-end developers, Architects and the rest of the team members to deliver high quality, scalable and user-friendly software solutions across different platforms. In this team you'll be able to make a large business impact by contributing to the success of "Our journey towards zero" initiative, where Kindred aim towards zero revenue from harmful gambling.
   

 You will participate in design discussions with your colleagues to find great solutions to complex engineering challenges. We strongly believe in the “You Design it, You Build It, You Test It, You Run It, You Tweak It” ethos and everyone is expected to take part of the full system / development life cycle to ensure reliability and uptime of the production environment. As a Senior Engineer at Kindred, sharing knowledge and best practices with the team come natural for you and you enjoy being an engaged member of the team who support your colleagues when needed.
   

 In this specific position, you will also have a chance to work with two teams as a front-end software engineer.
   

**Our technology stack include.**
* JavaScript, TypeScript, React and React Native
* CSS, UI libraries and HTML
* REST APIs
* CI/CD using Jenkins
* Micro frontend architecture
* Testing with Mocha/Jest
* Cypress E2E Testing
* State management with Redux or similar


**To excel in this role, we believe you…**
* Have commercial experience working as a Senior Frontend Developer/Engineer, with great skills in JavaScript, Typescript, React/Redux, and React Native
* Worked as a team member in an Agile team and familiar with Scrum, Kanban or similar frameworks.
* Are proficient with CSS, HTML and UI libraries.
* Have experience releasing components to production and keeping them up to date with appropriate versioning.
* Gave experience in integrations with REST-API's
* Enjoy having full ownership of your work and the SDLC including using appropriate testing techniques such as unit testing & integration testing.
* Have experience implementing CI/CD practices such as git branching, automated tests and automated deployment pipelines
* Are able to investigate, troubleshoot and solve production issues, or having previous experience working as an Incident Manager
* Have good appreciation of TDD/BDD
* Have good understanding of React Hooks
* Have experience developing mobile React Native Apps
