Rollen är placerad på Apotek Hjärtats Marknad och kommunikationsavdelning i Solna där du kommer att rapportera till chef content och tillhöra ett nytt content-team som skapar och optimerar innehåll till i första hand apotekhjartat.se, andra digitala och sociala kanaler kan också bli aktuella. Du kommer planera, genomföra och följa upp innehåll. Vi tvärfunktionellt tvärs bolaget och nära affären, framförallt e-handeln.Vi är ett dynamiskt och växande företag som strävar efter att vara ledande inom vårt område.

 **Hitta hem hos oss**


På Hjärtat har vi ett fantastiskt uppdrag: vi hjälper människor att må bättre. Vi finns för alla i Sverige – för de sjuka och för de friska, genom livets alla faser. Med 400 apotek i hela landet och en e-handel som aldrig stänger, finns vi alltid nära. Vi är över 4000 kollegor som tillsammans möter våra kunder med omtanke, var de än befinner sig. Tillsammans bygger vi en kultur där vi är ett lag som litar på varandra, ser varandras förmågor och där alla kan bidra och påverka. Där vi alltid utgår från vårt samhällsuppdrag och där det finns plats för nya idéer och innovation. För oss är det viktigt att ta vara på våra medarbetares kunskap och tankar och vår hemvist i ICA Gruppen ger stora möjligheter till både personlig och yrkesmässig utveckling. Här finns en plats för dig med Hjärtat på rätt ställe.

 **Vi söker dig som har/är****:**

* Stort intresse för hälsa
* Kreativ och älskar att skriva för digitala kanaler i Contentful eller likvärdigt CMS, hantera bilder i Adobe Photoshop samt håller koll på nya trender
* Analytisk förmåga med stor erfarenhet av SEO och Google Search Console
* Flytande svenska i tal och skrift
  

Det är meriterande om du har:

* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Google Analytics
* Arbetat i en större organisation eller bolag
* Skapat/klippt/beställt autentiskt innehåll för video exv YouTube, TikTok, Instagram
* Vana vid Adobe Creative Cloud och kan hantera såväl bild som rörligt
  

Nyfiken på mer? Lyssna på vårt podcastavsnitt om Apotek Hjärtat Supportkontor. Du hittar det här.

 **Din ansökan**


På Hjärtat strävar vi efter en jämn könsfördelning och ser mångfald som en styrka. Vi välkomnar därför sökande med olika bakgrund! Intervjuer sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag 2024-08-30, skicka in din ansökan redan idag. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå arbetspsykologiskatester och bakgrundskontroller innan anställning. All extern hjälp med rekrytering undanbedes.

  

Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid. Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas. Tillträde till tjänsten sker enligt överenskommelse. Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare annika.grundfors@apotekhjartat.se

  

**Välkommen till oss - ett apotek med Hjärtat på rätt ställe!**

title: Application Specialist till Tre
description:
***Välkommen till Tre, telekomoperatören som lyckats växa till ett stort, välfungerande företag – utan att tappa den lilla startupens energi. Lite som en punkare som börjat använda cykelhjälm. Vi går till jobbet för att utveckla, bygga och underhålla produkter, system och nät för att ge våra kunder bästa möjliga digitala upplevelse. Tre Technology är unika i sitt slag inom branschen, då vi har alla system och funktioner inhouse. Hos Tre jobbar vi med både svenska och danska mobilnätet och IT-miljö. Vill du vara med? Trevligt!***

  


Är du en problemlösare med passion för en stabil produktionsmiljö? Drömmer du om förbättringar, automatiseringar och att göra allt lite bättre och enklare? I så fall har vi den perfekta möjligheten för dig!



Enterprise IT & Operations ansvarar för att våra IT-system i produktion fungerar optimalt och möter kraven för bl a säkerhet, prestanda och stabilitet – från hårdvara och operativsystem till databaser och IT-applikationer. Vi övervakar våra system, agerar och sätter upp larm/KPIer, felsöker/analyserar loggar och ser till att produktionsmiljön är stabil inom vårt område.


**Hur kan en arbetsdag se ut?**  

I rollen som Application specialist kommer du att ingå i en grupp med tio kollegor som främst ansvarar för IT-applikationer som hanterar sälj, kundservice, provisionering och CRM. Du kommer att ansvara för flera olika applikationer inom dessa områden. Arbetsuppgifterna är väldigt varierande och passar dig som vill arbeta brett och tycker om snabba förändringar. Du övervakar system, hanterar larm samt felsöker produktionsproblem. Den centrala delen av rollen är att säkra systemets tillgänglighet, stabilitet och prestanda. Teamet fokuserar även på monitorering och KPIer. I tjänsten ingår schemalagt beredskapsarbete ungefär var 5:e vecka.



Vi befinner oss i en spännande förändringsresa i våra tekniska plattformar. Du får bidra med insikter och idéer i hur vi kontinuerligt förbättrar våra arbetssätt, processer och verktyg. Tror du ensam är stark? Nej, inte vi heller. På Tre arbetar vi i en snabbrörlig miljö där ny teknik och funktionalitet ständigt levereras. Vi har alla våra roller men först och främst är vi ett team med samma mål!


**Du kommer se fram emot att**


* tillhöra ett team med erfarna kollegor och ledare som har själv erfarenhet av din vardag
* bli erbjuden en teknisk miljö i där du lär dig nya saker varje dag
* ingå på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt, Great place to work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen av IT-Young Professionals
* ingå hos Tre Teknik som är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar samt att vi toppar listan bland kvinnor Tech att välja Tre som en framtida arbetsgivare


**Lite mer om dig**  

För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har ett brinnande intresse för teknik. Du kan med lätthet sätta dig in i djupgående tekniska detaljer för att sedan på ett pedagogiskt sätt kunna förmedla budskapets kärna för interna användare som arbetar mot kund. Därtill är du en person som aktivt jobbar med självledarskap för att, tillsammans med teamet, alltid kunna vara bäst på det du gör. Du har med dig flera års erfarenhet av liknande roll och det är meriterande om du är van vid att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.



När det kommer till teknisk erfarenhet behöver du ha kunskap av Linux, SQL och databaser. Du är nyfikenhet av att lära dig mer om Kubernetes, Openshift och Cloud services.


**Din ansökan**  

Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via denna annons och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas redan innan sista ansökningsdag, så tveka inte med att skicka in din ansökan. För mer information om tjänsten kontakta ansvarig chef Åsa Lindqvist.



Varmt välkommen till Tre!



#LI-PRIORITY


**Contact**
-----------

### **Åsa Lindqvist**


[email protected]

title: Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Sinch Messaging
description:
Sinch is a Customer Communication Cloud company, directly powering meaningful conversations at scale across messaging, voice and email to help businesses deliver unified, personalized experiences that truly revolve around their customers – no matter the channels they use. More than 150,000 businesses – including many of the world’s largest tech companies, rely on us for their customer communication needs.
  
We dream big – for our company, our customers and our employees – and we hire the best talent worldwide to help us bring our vision to life. We have near 4,500 Sinchers in more than 60 countries – probably somewhere near you!
  
  

About the role
  
If you're looking for a job that combines innovation, collaboration, and a friendly atmosphere, you've come to the right place! We are seeking a passionate and proven Sr. Product Marketing Manager to join our global product marketing team. Reporting to our Product Marketing Director of Messaging, you will own the product marketing strategy and positioning, and help the organization drive the GTM strategy for key audiences.
  
  

Join us and be a part of a team that values diversity, fosters creativity, and believes that great things happen when you work with talented and friendly colleagues.
  
  

**Key responsibilities:**  

* Define and implement a cohesive product marketing strategy that positions Sinch's Messaging products as a leader in the space globally
* Partner with regional sales and marketing leadership and other cross-functional teams to drive product adoption and revenue growth (go-to-market planning, product strategy, marketing campaigns, sales enablement and more)
* Partner with product managers to influence the product roadmap, product competitiveness, and drive product adoption by sharing key market & customer insights
* Advocate for our customers and become an authority on our competition to ensure our products are accurately positioned in the market
* Measure, analyze and optimize product marketing programs to deliver better business outcomes
* Act as thought leader on customer experience and messaging
* Own the product marketing toolkit for your product including messaging, positioning, competitive intelligence, and personas
* Develop product content for external and internal audiences, such as web pages, blog posts, one-pagers, sales decks, demos, and feature functionality assets
* Launch new product features and identify ways to drive engagement for existing features
* Train and empower cross-functional teams to be product champions


**About you:**  

To be successful in the role you have solid experience of product marketing, having gained that experience in large international and complex organizations. You are a great collaborator and communicator who can bridge the gap between product, marketing and sales teams. You have strong analytical skills and ability to develop recommendations based on product, customer, and market data. Last but not least you are a critical thinker with excellent writing and presentation skills.
  
  

* Extensive experience in product marketing at technology companies, ideally from large, international and complex organizations
* Proven experience as a senior product marketing manager, launching a new product or working on complex product launches
* Experience communicating effectively and presenting to a diverse and senior range of stakeholders across different time zones
* Experience in customer communication tools or CPaaS is a plus
* Ability to travel if needed


Our Values
  
At Sinch we “Dream Big”, “Win Together”, “Keep it simple” and “Make it Happen”. These values are our foundation for fostering an environment where diversity of thinking, skills and experiences are embraced, delivering innovation and better business results.
  
  

Bring your authentic self to Sinch
  
Here at Sinch we embrace diversity and work to create an inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive. No matter who you are, you'll be able to explore new career and growth options - sharing your voice, building your path and making it happen with us.
  
We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will be considered to join our team regardless of race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class.
  
  

Our Hiring Process
  
At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high performing teams.
  
Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.
  
  

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/
company_description: We help companies to communicate with customers via messaging, voice and video using multiple channels. Simplifying life by bringing all people and businesses together using technology is our purpose.

title: English and Spanish speaking Account Manager to Linköping
description:
The company has developed a groundbreaking cloud service for transportation companies. They have customers all over the world.
  
They are experiencing strong demand of their product and because of that they need to strengthen their sales with a Spanish and English speaking salesperson.
  
We are looking for an outgoing and self-motivated Spanish and English speaking person who wants to work with sales from the company's office in Linköping towards North America.
  
  

About you
  
Qualifications for this job
  
* A couple of years’ experience in B2B sales.
* Excellent customer assistance and problem solving skills.
* Fluent in English and Spanish with no accent.


We see it as a positive if you have previous experience in working with international SaaS sales.
  
  

About this position
  
You will mostly work with assigned qualified leads.
  
A lead is a transportation company who is looking to upgrade their booking system.
  
You will work with the full sales cycle from first demo to a closed deal. After the deal is closed you will continue working with the customers to make sure we keep them happy.
  
The sales will mainly be done via web meetings and phone, so travelling will not be required for this position.
  
It is a very developing job in an international environment where you will interact with a lot of people every day.

title: Student Content Creator to Epishine
description:
Are you an ambitious student looking for a flexible part time job within marketing? Are you also a dynamic thinker who thrives on creativity in a fast-paced workplace? Finally, do you want to be a part of a growing company in the clean energy sector, and contribute to a more sustainable planet? Then the role as Student Content Creator at Epishine might be the perfect match!
  
About Epishine Epishine is a Swedish energy impact company, reimagining the capture of light with market leading printed organic solar cells. Our technology captures indoor light to make electronics self-powered, making cables, disposable batteries and unnecessary maintenance a thing of the past. At Epishine, we foster a culture of collaboration, creativity and innovation where we encourage our employees to challenge the status quo and drive innovation.
  
Our company is now growing and we are looking for more driven talents who want to develop together with us. Go to www.epishine.com to read more about Epishine and our vision.
  
The missionAs our Student Content Creator, you will be a part of our Commercial team and support in the visual aspects of our brand as well as copy for our sales colleagues and our external channels. Together with our brilliant Content Creator Lina, you will work to strengthen Epishine’s brand recognition through well-crafted content that you create and publish. Some examples of what the role includes are:
  
Design graphics for our organic and paid channels, aligned with our corporate branding
  
Support in the coordination of our content calendar
  
Support in the planning of international trade shows
  
  

We estimate needing your assistance for about 5-20 hours per week, with some presence required at our Linköping office, though remote work options are also available. We are confident that we will work out a solution that works for everyone!
  
Who are we looking for? We are looking for a student who loves creatingtargeted messages for different stakeholders. We believe that you are eager to learn more within the field of marketing and content creation, both regarding written communication as well as with graphic design. You have experience working with Adobe Creative Cloud. It is beneficial if you are on the path towards a degree in graphic design, communication or similar, however not a must.
  
You have a technical interest which will help you communicate the value of Epishine and our product. You have good English skills as all our communication is conducted in English, and you will be working with colleagues and customers from all over the world.
  
Lastly, we believe you have the confidence and initiative to work on projects independently and see them through with a structured and responsible approach. Your open and creative mindset will help you build and communicate Epishine’s brand in an innovative and successful way.
  
What do we offer? At Epishine, we offer the chance to be part of an exciting journey and the opportunity to contribute to a more sustainable planet. As a quickly growing scale-up, there will be opportunities for development, and you will have brilliant colleagues to collaborate with and learn from. Additionally, we offer a friendly company culture where collaboration, innovation and sustainability are at our core.
  
Application procedure Does this role sound exciting? We work with ongoing selection, so send in your application today. The start date is mutually agreed, but we would love for you to join us as soon as possible.
  
If you have any queries about this recruitment, please contact our HR- andrecruitment partner Emma Bjurling (emma.bjurling@epishine.se)

title: Fullstack Engineer
description:
Fullstack Engineer to Alva Labs
  
Hiring practices need to change if organizations are going to stand a fighting chance in adapting to the future. With so many jobs predicted to drastically change in the coming years, it is crucial to find a more efficient and accurate way to find the right talent. The legacy of CV screening is not only treating candidates unfairly, it also puts organizations at risk of not identifying who will grow and adapt to the changes that lie ahead.
  
Do you want to be part of the solution? Our dream team in engineering is growing and we want more talented people onboard, to take part in building a product that reaches thousands of users - candidates and recruiters - daily, and impacts life-changing decisions.
  
The company
  
If one should summarize what we as a company are doing, it could be something like this:
  
Alva Labs is a Stockholm-based SaaS company that offers a solution that is helping global companies grow their team in a scientific way. Alva has created a unique candidate assessment platform that helps companies build their organisations with the right people in the right place. Combining state-of-the-art psychometrics, data science, and an obsession with candidate experience, it provides the needed tool for data-driven talent acquisition.
  
Our main focus as of now is to launch our next big product bet that will revolutionize how the world hires talent. By broadening our product offering we will be able to better serve our customers and solve a larger part of their problem. We have also reworked out commercial focus to work with larger and more complex organisations. We believe that by serving this segment, we neutralize the impact of the economic environment and maximize our impact on how the market views talent.
  
The role
  
The day-to-day work in Alva’s engineering team is performed in product squads focused on different product surfaces. Currently, we’re divided into four different squads, each team aims to be self-sufficient and consists of a Product Manager, Designer, and three to five engineers.
  
  

**Within 1 month you have:**  

Received the support you need in order to get a good start at Alva.
  
Started to familiarize yourself with the product and the platform.
  
Started contributing to the team’s work.
  
  

**Within 3 months you have:**  

Been programming in all parts of the tech stack. All the way from frontend to backend and cloud infrastructure.
  
Helped your team to build new features quicker than we otherwise would have - the velocity has increased significantly.
  
  

**Within 6 months you have:**  

Become comfortable programming in all parts of the tech stack.
  
Impacted the quality of the product, getting to the point where we fix all bugs and improve performance metrics.
  
Started to feel proud of the part of the product and the codebase you are working with.
  
  

You
  
Your specific background isn’t super important to us, as we are more interested in who you are as a person and that you are a skilled mid-level engineer. Ideally, you have a couple of years of experience working as a full-stack engineer and are used to leading technical discovery of complex problems. We don’t care too much about which programming languages or technologies you’ve been using in the past, but experience with the following would definitely be a benefit.
  
The core of our tech stack is;
  
Python
  
React, JavaScript/TypeScript
  
Google Cloud Platform
  
Pub/Sub
  
PostgreSQL, Firestore
  
Kubernetes, Cloud Run
  
GraphQL
  
Protocol buffers
  
Event-driven microservices
  
  

Interested in more details? Continue to read → here ←.
  
We would also be happy if you;
  
Love solving complex problems and turning them into solutions that breathe simplicity.
  
Are ambitious and structured.
  
Are a prestigeless team player and enjoy supporting your coworkers.
  
Our day-to-day language is English, so no need to speak Swedish.
  
Live in or are open to relocating to Stockholm
  
  

Your future colleagues
  
We are a team of 60+ people, representing a wide selection of professional backgrounds. And all of that is absolutely fantastic, but the true beauty is the trust and warmth you will experience. You will most likely never be in a place where people are as nerdy about what we do, and have so many brilliant minds to learn from and ask for guidance. To quote our CEO during our last company trip, “It feels like hanging out with a bunch of old friends”.
  
What we offer
  
We strongly believe that experimentation is the best way of learning and making decisions about product and technology. Therefore, we try our best to keep the feedback loops short to iteratively improve our product and our system.
  
The problem we are solving is not just engaging and interesting (the combination of psychological science and statistics, with a large chunk of candidate experience obsession, what’s not to love?), but it is also something that has a tremendous impact on both people and businesses. You will have the opportunity to work with something that truly makes a difference.
  
What else? We have flexible work hours where we spend at least 3 days a week at the office. You will get seven weeks of vacation, an on-market salary, a generous preventive care benefit, and a few other neat perks. You can read all about our benefits → here ← and our company values → here ←.
  
The hiring process
  
Given that we claim to be experts in hiring, you probably wonder what we have in store for you.
  
Objective screening with Alva’s own tests (and your first interaction with the product we build!)
  
First interview with HR after summer (focusing on who you are)
  
Tech assessment to complete at home (and your second interaction with our product)
  
System design interview with an Engineering manager
  
Final interview with CTO and COO
  
Background- and ID check (yes, we take security seriously)
  
Done deal!

title: Application Specialist till Tre
description:
Välkommen till Tre, telekomoperatören som lyckats växa till ett stort, välfungerande företag – utan att tappa den lilla startupens energi. Lite som en punkare som börjat använda cykelhjälm. Vi går till jobbet för att utveckla, bygga och underhålla produkter, system och nät för att ge våra kunder bästa möjliga digitala upplevelse. Tre Technology är unika i sitt slag inom branschen, då vi har alla system och funktioner inhouse. Hos Tre jobbar vi med både svenska och danska mobilnätet och IT-miljö. Vill du vara med? Trevligt!
  
  

Är du en problemlösare med passion för en stabil produktionsmiljö? Drömmer du om förbättringar, automatiseringar och att göra allt lite bättre och enklare? I så fall har vi den perfekta möjligheten för dig!
  
  

Enterprise IT & Operations ansvarar för att våra IT-system i produktion fungerar optimalt och möter kraven för bl a säkerhet, prestanda och stabilitet – från hårdvara och operativsystem till databaser och IT-applikationer. Vi övervakar våra system, agerar och sätter upp larm/KPIer, felsöker/analyserar loggar och ser till att produktionsmiljön är stabil inom vårt område.
  
  

Hur kan en arbetsdag se ut?
  
I rollen som Application specialist kommer du att ingå i en grupp med tio kollegor som främst ansvarar för IT-applikationer som hanterar sälj, kundservice, provisionering och CRM. Du kommer att ansvara för flera olika applikationer inom dessa områden. Arbetsuppgifterna är väldigt varierande och passar dig som vill arbeta brett och tycker om snabba förändringar. Du övervakar system, hanterar larm samt felsöker produktionsproblem. Den centrala delen av rollen är att säkra systemets tillgänglighet, stabilitet och prestanda. Teamet fokuserar även på monitorering och KPIer. I tjänsten ingår schemalagt beredskapsarbete ungefär var 5:e vecka.
  
  

Vi befinner oss i en spännande förändringsresa i våra tekniska plattformar. Du får bidra med insikter och idéer i hur vi kontinuerligt förbättrar våra arbetssätt, processer och verktyg. Tror du ensam är stark? Nej, inte vi heller. På Tre arbetar vi i en snabbrörlig miljö där ny teknik och funktionalitet ständigt levereras. Vi har alla våra roller men först och främst är vi ett team med samma mål!
  
  

Du kommer se fram emot att
  
  

* tillhöra ett team med erfarna kollegor och ledare som har själv erfarenhet av din vardag
* bli erbjuden en teknisk miljö i där du lär dig nya saker varje dag
* ingå på en av Sveriges bästa arbetsplatser enligt, Great place to work samt att vi är topprankade hos Karriärföretagen av IT-Young Professionals
* ingå hos Tre Teknik som är stolt samarbetspartner till Women in Tech och Tjejer Kodar samt att vi toppar listan bland kvinnor Tech att välja Tre som en framtida arbetsgivare


Lite mer om dig
  
För att trivas i rollen tror vi att du har ett brinnande intresse för teknik. Du kan med lätthet sätta dig in i djupgående tekniska detaljer för att sedan på ett pedagogiskt sätt kunna förmedla budskapets kärna för interna användare som arbetar mot kund. Därtill är du en person som aktivt jobbar med självledarskap för att, tillsammans med teamet, alltid kunna vara bäst på det du gör. Du har med dig flera års erfarenhet av liknande roll och det är meriterande om du är van vid att kommunicera på både svenska och engelska.
  
  

När det kommer till teknisk erfarenhet behöver du ha kunskap av Linux, SQL och databaser. Du är nyfikenhet av att lära dig mer om Kubernetes, Openshift och Cloud services.
  
  

Din ansökan
  
Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via denna annons och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas redan innan sista ansökningsdag, så tveka inte med att skicka in din ansökan. För mer information om tjänsten kontakta ansvarig chef Åsa Lindqvist.
  
  

Varmt välkommen till Tre!
  
  

#LI-PRIORITY

title: Dealer Inventory Analyst
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

**Who are we?**
---------------


Service Market Logistics, part of Volvo Group Trucks Operations, serves all brands and business areas by managing and optimizing service parts availability and distribution to secure customer uptime. Through our operations, we provide world class service focusing on delivery precision, quality, continuous improvement, cost efficiency and synergies delivering value all the way to our customers. We embrace innovation and new technologies and work with environmental care and sustainability at heart. Our footprint consists of 40 distribution centers and 3,800 employees worldwide, and we strive for an innovative and diverse workplace, exercising the Volvo Group values with high focus on Customer Success. We are Proud to Deliver. Making a Difference. For People. Every Day.

  

Our Organization, Supply Chain Optimization is a global team of roughly 115 people who plan the service market supply networks all the way from supplier to dealer inventory. What we do has a direct impact on the satisfaction of the Volvo Group customers.

  

The Dealer Inventory Management Analyst team is a diverse team of innovative colleagues with various backgrounds and skills, ranging from supply chain expertise to digital development and software engineering.  

Collaboration and transparent communication are key for us. With daily stand ups and an agile approach, we cherish a supportive environment where we combine our different skills and passions to make magic together.

  

Learn more about who we are at Volvo Group Service Market Logistics on YouTube.

**Who are you?**
----------------


Do you hold a degree in Supply Chain Management, Computer Science, or Information Technology?  

Are you a team player and a curious analyst who values the importance of collaborative development in a global environment?  

Are you passionate about delivering excellent customer service and business performance, utilizing digital technologies and insights based on data?  

Then you might be just the one we are looking for to join our team in Dealer Inventory Management!

  

We believe you are  

* Experienced in working with Python, SQL and PySpark and skilled in Azure Data bricks, Azure Data factory.
* Proficiency in using Git for version control and collaboration.
* Experience with agile methodologies in product development
* Skilled in data analytics and able to tell a story based on data.
* Interested in Supply Chain Management and Inventory Optimization.
* A critical thinker with problem solving skills.
* A self-starter who is comfortable to leave well-trodden paths and engage cross functionally.
  

Regardless of which of the above areas your strengths are, in our team you will have the opportunity to use your unique skills to really make a difference for the future together with supporting colleagues in a highly international and skilled team.

**What do we do?**
------------------


We combine knowledge in supply chain with digital skills to optimize our current supply chain and build capabilities for a better and more sustainable tomorrow.  

  

We secure an optimized steering of spare parts to our 4000 Volvo Group dealers around the globe through an automated inventory concept, balancing end customer availability with a sustainable and cost-efficient supply chain.  

Next to our people, data is our strongest asset. Knowing this, we are working closely with IT resources to build a robust dealer data analytical layer that will support data-driven decision-making throughout the company.  

  

We are transforming the way we plan our supply chain as we are in the making of digitalizing our planning processes. We do this by building our own cloud native planning solution allowing agile software development to drive the continuous improvement of supply chain planning capabilities moving forward. This requires a team consisting of, not only digitalization knowledge but also a strong supply chain knowledge contributing to our transformation journey.


You can learn more about Volvo Group DIM (Dealer Inventory Management) concept on YouTube.

**Curious?**
------------


If you're keen on being part of our journey, we invite you to submit your application today. The final day to apply is August 29th.


For any questions about the role, please contact the hiring manager Kristina Wennerholm at kristina.wennerholm@volvo.com.

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Group Trucks Operations** encompasses all production of the Group’s manufacturing of Volvo, Renault and Mack trucks, as well as engines and transmissions. We also orchestrate the spare parts distribution for Volvo Group’s customers globally and design, operate and optimize logistics and supply chains for all brands. We count 30,000 employees at 30 plants and 50 distribution centers across the globe. Our global footprint offers an opportunity for an international career in a state-of-the-art industrial environment, where continuous improvement is the foundation. As our planet is facing great challenges, we - one of the largest industrial organizations in the world - stand at the forefront of innovation. We are ready to rise to the challenge. Would you like to join us?
company_description: Every day, we work with some of the sharpest and most creative brains in our field to leave our society in better shape for the next generation.

title: Application Expert - Logistics Warehouse Partners
description:
**Company Description**  

At H&M group – Business Tech, we are accelerating digitalization and to stay relevant, we need to ensure we have strong competences in place to improve our end-to-end supply chain & warehouse processes both online and in store.  

  

You will work within a product team who focuses on realizing business outcomes through tech, working with integrating logistics warehouse partners (3PL) into H&M Group logistics flow and to H&M Group sales channels, to help securing product availability as well as fast and accurate deliveries to the customers.  

  

This role reports to Engineering Manager – Application Experts but you will work on daily basis with Warehouse 3PL Product Team with dotted line to Product Manager.

 **Job Description**  

As Application Expert you will work with different aspects of warehouse integrations involving external logistic partners. Your will be coordinating and driving initiatives from ideation to completion between our partners’ WMS (Warehouse Management System) and H&M internal systems. One key part is the analysis of business needs and their translation into suitable, maintainable and scalable solution designs. You are a midpoint for the communication towards internal and external stakeholders.  

  

Responsibilities:  

  

You will work alongside a Product Manager, Business Expert and Software Engineers in an agile team, responsible for improving and maintaining solutions that enhance our customer experience.  

  

Furthermore, you will:

* Work with our distribution partners and warehouse 3PL teams.
* Work with professional software engineering practices & best practices for the entire software development life cycle.
* Monitor and troubleshoot incidents and answer end-user questions.
* Implement configurations to improve and expand our solutions.
* Work with Tests and documentation.
* Collaborate closely with product manager and other cross-functional teams (especially business functions), analyze requirements, share best practices, and discuss and motivate design solutions.

 **Qualifications**  

As an application expert at H&M Group, you will embark on a journey that will lead to something new and exciting - we will test, fail, and learn. You are an important player in this transformation and are communicative, flexible, and stress resistant. You have previous experience working in large companies with many stakeholders and have worked with distributed teams.  

  

We also believe that you:

* Have a bachelor’s degree in computer science, engineering and/or related business knowledge
* 5+ years of experience in analysing requirements, coordinating projects and testing
* Strong experience in working and collaborating with external providers in a global set-up
* Experience working with any SAAS platform, configuring, troubleshooting, and supporting end users.
* Have a demonstrated history of working according to agile practices with knowledge of Scrum & SAFE.


Nice to have:

* Solid understanding of retail & logistic processes.
* “You build it, and you run it” mindset.
* Have experience working with Jira, ServiceNow etc.
* Understanding of Azure cloud platform
* Knowledge of facilitating workshops

 **Additional Information**  

This is a permanent full-time position open for location **Stockholm.**


Application period is open till **30th** **of September** .


We are eager to meet you! :)

**Benefits at H&M**  

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

*We strive to have a fair and equal process and therefore kindly ask you not to attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that easily can trigger unintentional biases.*

title: Quality Assurance Lead
description:
Would you like to enable Resurs to deliver better software faster? We are looking for an experienced Test Strategist who will own and manage our testing strategy.
  
Get an idea of the roleAs a QA-lead at Resurs youshould have a deep understanding of working according to regulatory frameworks and test. You will lead the development, implementation, and maintenance of effective testing processes according to best practices and our established tools and frameworks.
  
You will ensure that testing is performed in accordance with the strategy and that results from all automated and manual tests are measured and analyzed thoroughly. Additionally, you will be responsible for enabling teams to measure their tests and monitor test environments. Your contribution is a critical part of enabling Resursin improving our CI/CD pipelines.You will lead a quality assurance chapter with of a wide variety of testers within the organization and ensure that relevant test data is used in the testing processes. The role also involves building a test-focused culture by guiding and mentoring developers in writing unit tests and implementing contract tests.
  
On a personal levelWith your strong leadership skills and ability to make decisions, you will promote information exchange. It is advantageous if you have personal experience with all forms of testing, from manual testing to technical functional and non-functional testing.To succeed in this role we also believe thatyou have anISTQB certification.Experience with security testing is also considered a plus, as well as prior experience in testing in a cloud native microservice architecture.We are lookig forward to read your application!Important information
  
On final candidates, we carry out a detailed background check via an external company
  
More than a job
  
Resurs is a leading bank in the Nordics with a simple philosophy: we want to create balance in people’s personal finances. On that foundation, we develop offers and services within loans, savings and payments for retail and e-commerce that are based on people’s everyday lives, and that will create long-term value for our customers. And for society. Today, we have a customer base of slightly more than 6 million customers and around 650 employees in the Nordic region. Apply today!
  
Don’t wait to send in your application - selection, and interviews take place on an ongoing basis and the position may be filled before the last advertising date. We look forward to hearing from you!
  
* In this recruitment process, the supplier is solely responsible for the personal data they collect and process. Resurs is solely responsible for the personal data processed by us in the recruitment process.#LI-LN1

title: Head of Tech Platforms
description:
**Head of Tech Platforms till ICA** 




 Med visionen "Vi gör varje dag lite enklare" är ICA Gruppen ett av de ledande detaljhandelsföretagen i Norden. Gruppen inkluderar ICA Sverige och Rimi Baltic, som främst bedriver dagligvaruhandel, ICA Fastigheter som äger och förvaltar fastigheter, ICA Banken som erbjuder finansiella tjänster, ICA Försäkring som tillhandahåller försäkringsprodukter, och Apotek Hjärtat med apoteksverksamhet. Med över 23 000 anställda och en omsättning på 148 miljarder SEK under 2023, har ICA Gruppen mer än 1500 livsmedelsbutiker och cirka 400 apotek.
 



  





**Situation** 




 För att möta kraven i dagens snabbrörliga digitala landskap har ICA bildat Digital & Technology-organisationen för att optimera affärsvärdet för ICA Sverige och stödja alla operativa bolag (OpCos) inom gruppen. Organisationen integrerar teknik och affärsverksamhet över fyra affärsflöden med fokus på kunder och Handlare. Tech Delivery, en viktig del av denna struktur, ansvarar för gemensamma leveranser och infrastruktur. Nyligen blev Mats Erlandsson, tidigare Head of Tech Platforms, befordrad till Director Tech Delivery, vilket skapar en möjlighet att fylla hans tidigare roll.
 



  





**Rollen** 




 Som Head of Tech Platforms kommer du att ha strategiskt, taktiskt och operativt ansvar för alla leveranser från Tech Platforms i enlighet med affärsmål och -strategier. I rollen har du 4 direktrapporterande och ett totalt team på cirka 65 FTEs (inklusive ett offshoring-nav i Rumänien). Bland annat kommer du att:
 


* Samarbeta nära med funktioner inom Digital & Tech, ICA Sveriges affärsområden och andra OpCos för att leverera stabila produktionssystem och tekniska lösningar som stärker ICAs affärsvärde.
* Leda och driva effektiva arbetssätt som stärker ICAs förmåga att utveckla affärsfunktionalitet med hjälp av tekniska plattformar.
* Styra organisationen vertikalt för optimerad teknisk kapacitet och ekonomisk effektivitet, och horisontellt för att säkerställa integrerad leverans med andra funktioner för att skapa affärsvärde.
* Genom ditt team, säkerställa processeffektivitet genom digital utveckling, automation och analys.
* Ha övergripande ansvar för områdets roadmap, KPI och strategisk styrning i synk med ICAs fokusområden, och säkerställa att dessa kommuniceras till alla intressenter.
* Ha övergripande ansvar för personal, kvalitet, stabilitet, kostnadseffektivitet och leverantörsrelationer.



  





**Vi söker dig som** 



* Har erfarenhet av att leda i en komplex roll med hög förändringstakt
* Har relevant eftergymnasial utbildning inom systemvetenskap, informationssystem eller motsvarande
* Har erfarenhet av ledarskap och att leda arbete i komplexa organisationer
* Har stark teknisk förståelse för området och solid ekonomisk insikt
* Har erfarenhet av att leda leverantörer både operativt och strategiskt
* Har erfarenhet av chefsroller med personalansvar
* Är skicklig på att leda och driva tekniska projekt
* Har erfarenhet av tekniskt komplexa, affärskritiska miljöer med leveranser till olika typer av verksamheter
* Är adept på att driva utveckling, leda förändring eller hantera projekt från behovsbedömning till implementering
* Är flytande i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift



  





 Navigio är vår partner i denna rekrytering. Vi granskar ansökningar löpande så vänligen ansök så snart som möjligt, så hör vi av oss efter 5 augusti.

title: Product Sales Specialist [gn] Nordics
description:
HCL Software is a division of HCL Technologies (HCL). HCL Technologies is an $11.18 billion employer with over 197,000 employees and offices worldwide. HCL Software is designed, marketed, sold and delivered with over 30 product families with a particular focus on customer experience, digital solutions, DevOps security and automation.
 



  





 Our mission is to drive the end result of customer investments in IT and innovation of new software products. This is done quickly and rapidly, and it takes a long time to build a lab that can become the largest software company in the world. Please note that HCL Software is trading rapidly for over $1 billion and will make an impact from day one. This is an emotional time to use HCL Software, a medium that has no expansion, investment and we grow.
 



  





**Your responsibilities will include:** 




  





 • Serving as a subject matter expert and evangelist, delivering high-quality presentations and workshops to clients,
 



 including Developers, Architects, IT managers, and CxOs.
 



 • Acting as a complex deal coach and/or executive sponsor on key opportunities.
 



 • Collaborating closely with the sales team to create compelling proposals and solutions tailored to customer needs.
 



 • Working with internal support partners to ensure effective coordination and communication throughout the sales
 



 process.
 



 • Partnering with HCL Services Solution delivery team in the successful delivery of Proofs of Concept (PoCs).
 



 • Developing technical sales capabilities and competencies with HCLSoftware partners to promote the adoption of (Our
 



 product) solutions.
 



 • Maintaining a thorough understanding of the client's industry and competitive landscape.
 



 • Building and managing a sales pipeline of high-value accounts to exceed acquisition and output goals.
 



 • Serving as the first point of contact for current and prospective customers.
 



 • Presenting and negotiating with Executive Leadership, both internally and externally.
 



 • Meeting sales targets through a solutions-focused approach, always prioritizing customer needs.
 



 • Experience of using sales opportunity qualification tools such MEDDPICCR.
 



  





**What you’ll bring:** 




  





 • 5 years of sales/pre-sales experience in the enterprise software industry.
 



 • Executive-level selling experience and consultative selling capabilities.
 



 • Exceptional presentation skills for delivering executive-level and value-based presentations.
 



 • Strong ability to understand and articulate solutions based on the HCL software portfolio.
 



 • Proven track record of generating new business and developing long-term partnerships.
 



 • Familiarity with competitive and their market positioning.
 



 • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively with C-level executives.

title: Cloud Technician till Cary Group
description:
Är du kunnig inom Azure och lockas av en roll där du får omvandla teknik till nytta för verksamheten och dess användare? Lockas du av en roll där du får vara ansvarig för att leda och designa infrastrukturen?
   

  

 Då kan rollen som Cloud Technician på Cary Group passa dig väl!
   

  

**DIN VARDAG**
 Som Cloud Technician är du en viktig del i våra nya och befintliga IT projekt.
   

  

 Du är ansvarig för att proaktivt leda, motivera och utmana kunder i projekt och hjälpa dem att omvandla teknik till nytta för vår verksamhet och dess användare.
   

  

 I rollen förväntas du också att utföra design av arkitektur och förstudier, tekniska implementationer, dokumentation och andra kringliggande uppgifter. För att lyckas i din roll förväntas du ha en kunskap om teknisk arkitektur som inkluderar både det tekniska och det affärsmässiga.
   

  

 Som Cloud Technician skall du vara med och utveckla Azure som affärsområde i samråd med de andra affärsområdena, med fokus på att hitta synergier mellan teamen för att skapa en optimerad process från kundförfrågan till avslutat projekt och förvaltning av kund i vår interna miljö.
   

  

 Du skall också:
   

  

* Ha ansvar för att leda och designa infrastruktur, fatta beslut om korrekt design och implementering av Azure.
* Designa en innovativ och praktisk strategi som står för en helhetslösning i linje med våra affärsmål.
* Hålla dig uppdaterad på förändringar i mjukvara och teknik som är mest relevant för verksamheten, och främjar användningen av nya lösningar för att maximera effektivitet, tillförlitlighet och värde.
* Planera och genomföra workshops internt och med samarbetspartners och leverantörer.
* Agera mentor och träna juniora tekniker samt granska arbete som utförs så arbetet håller högsta kvalitet.
* Ansvara för att dokumentera intern miljö.
* Utföra supportärenden som eskalerats till 3rd-line.
* Agera betrodd rådgivare till vår verksamhet och säkerhetsställa att vi håller högsta kvalitet i vår leverans -innan, under och efter projekt.
* Omvärldsbevakning- hålla dig uppdaterad om det senaste från Microsoft och andra leverantörer.


**VEM ÄR DU?**
 Vi letar efter dig som har goda kunskaper inom IT-infrastrukturteknologier och Microsoft Azure. Du har tidigare erfarenhet av leverantörstsyrning i en beställaroll och trivs i en roll med fokus på affärsnytta och användarvänlighet.
   

  

 Du skall också ha:
   

  

* God problemlösningsförmåga och god analytisk förmåga.
* Utmärkta kommunikations- och samarbetsförmågor och trivas med samarbete i team.
* Starkt tekniskt intresse och hålla sig uppdaterad på nya teknologier och bäst praxis.
* Tala och skriva flytande svenska och engelska.


 Det är meriterande om du har kännedom om ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library) principer och praxis för IT-tjänstehantering.
   

  

 Som person ser vi att du är ansvarstagande och proaktiv. Du har lätt för att anpassa dig och vara flexibel i ditt sätt, och trivas med ansvar för IT-driften. Rollen kräver också att du är kundorienterad och trivs med att ge god service och support till användarna.
   

  

**OM CARY GROUP**
 Välkommen till
 **Cary Group** 
 – en snabbväxande internationell koncern med den perfekta mixen av entreprenöriell anda och trygg struktur. Vi är en av marknadsledarna i Sverige, Danmark, Norge, Storbritannien, Spanien, Portugal, Tyskland, Österrike, Luxemburg och Belgien inom reparation och byte av fordonsglas med ett kompletterande erbjudande inom reparation av plåt- och lackskador. Vi erbjuder tjänster som förlänger fordonens livslängd och bibehåller deras säkerhetsfunktioner, och vi strävar alltid efter att reparera i stället för att byta ut. Cary Group har under de senaste åren vuxit snabbt, bl.a. via förvärv både internationellt och nationellt. Med närhet till kunden, högkvalitativa produkter och smarta lösningar hjälper vi kunden att göra enkla och hållbara val.
   

  

 Vi månar om vår varma, inkluderande kultur och investerar i aktiviteter och event för att stärka vårt team.
   

  

 Vårt kontor är beläget i Hammarby sjöstad i Stockholm.
   

  

 För mer information besök, Hem - Cary Group
   

  

**ANSÖKAN & KONTAKT**
 I denna rekrytering samarbetar Cary Group med Wise IT. Om du vill veta mer om jobbet, kontakta ansvarig rekryteringskonsult, Sandra Åhs, på sandra.ahs@wiseit.se. Wise IT kan tyvärr inte ta emot ansökningar via e-post, då vi värnar om din personliga integritet.
   

  

 Du kan läsa mer om hur vi behandlar personuppgifter enligt GDPR i Wise Group-koncernens policy för behandling av personuppgifter. Urval för tjänsten sker löpande.
   

  

 Urval och intervjuer sker löpande.
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Lead Back End Engineer
description:
**About Us:**
 We are a global tech startup based in Sweden in the midst of our go-to-market phase with a global network of partners on a mission to lead the digital transformation of the live and in-home entertainment industry.
   

  

 We are partnering with rights holders, show producers, promoters and the in-home entertainment industry to pave the way for the next generation home entertainment, by creating the most immersive and engaging way of experiencing live shows from home.
   

  

 We are pushing the limits of technology for an unparalleled social and interactive experience.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Develop and enhance a scalable backend infrastructure using .NET on Azure, focusing on scalability, reliability, and performance.
* Implement advanced backend solutions utilizing Azure Functions to support various services and applications.
* Take ownership of backend services from concept through development to launch, ensuring high-quality features and continuous improvements.
* Design and develop robust, secure, and maintainable RESTl APIs and microservices.
* Optimize backend services for performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency.
* Monitor and troubleshoot backend systems in real-time, ensuring high availability and quick resolution of issues.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration between backend and client applications.
* Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies, integrating relevant advancements into the backend infrastructure.


**Skills and Experience** 
  

  

* Proficient in backend development using .NET, with a strong foundation in cloud technologies, particularly Azure.
* Extensive experience in designing and implementing scalable, reliable, and high-performance backend systems.
* Strong understanding and hands-on experience with Azure Functions and serverless architecture.
* Highly self-motivated and capable of working independently, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills and the ability to initiate and complete projects.
* Solid knowledge of REST API design and microservices architecture.
* Experience with monitoring and troubleshooting backend systems to ensure high availability.
* Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies, with a proactive approach to learning and integrating new advancements.


**Join us early for an incredible opportunity**
 At Imagien, we're not just ambitious; we're trailblazers with considerable traction and partnerships already lined up with the biggest names in the industry. We offer a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of change in the world of show business and in-home entertainment.
   

  

 This is an exciting stage to join – a time when you can significantly impact our team culture and influence every hire, shaping the future of our team.
   

  

**Benefits:**
 A combination of salary, bonus, and equity to be adjusted and tailored together, to ensure the total package works best for you.

title: IT Application Specialist till Linde Gas
description:
Linde Gas söker en stark problemlösare med passion för teknik som vill fortsätta utvecklas i rollen som Applikationsspecialist. Här en del av ett starkt team med hög kompetens och engagemang. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Linde Gas
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna, Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Applikationsspecialist på Linde Gas kommer du att ansvara för två plattformar, Accura och Linx. Accura är en egenutvecklad applikation som används av Lindes kunder, såsom sjukhus, för att hantera lager och beställningar. Linx är en handdatorapplikation för Lindes återförsäljare i syfte att hålla koll på lagerhållning. Du kommer att arbeta nära applikationsägare och externa partners för att underhålla och förbättra dessa system, samt säkerställa att de fungerar optimalt.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att arbeta på ett globalt företag med stora utvecklingsmöjligheter
  
* Stöd och utbildning för att utveckla din tekniska kompetens
  
* En dynamisk arbetsmiljö med engagerade och kunniga kollegor
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Utföra underhåll, uppdatering och utveckling på plattformarna
  
* Ge kvalificerad systemteknisk support i samarbete med applikationsögare
  
* Arbeta direkt med applikationsägare för att förstå och hjälpa till att definiera nya applikationskrav
  
* Säkerställa lämplig kunskapsöverföring för applikationer som utvecklats med externa partners för att möjliggöra internt stöd
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant utbildningsbakgrund, troligtvis inom IT
  
* Har erfarenhet av applikationsutveckling, och gärna SAP-relaterad
  
* Grundläggande kunskaper i Java och Azure
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift
  
* Har en bred teknisk bakgrund
  
* Har erfarenhet av att hantera leverantörer
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Stabil
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Linde Gas**

 Linde är ett ledande globalt företag inom industrigaser och teknik. Linde lever efter sin mission att göra vår värld mer produktiv varje dag genom att tillhandahålla högkvalitativa lösningar, teknologier och tjänster som gör deras kunder mer framgångsrika och hjälper till att upprätthålla, avkarbonisera och skydda vår planet.
 


  


 Lindes industrigaser och teknologier används i otaliga applikationer, inklusive produktion av ren väte som är kritisk för energiomställningen, livräddande medicinsk syrgas och högrenade specialgaser för elektronik, bland annat. I över 50 år har Linde varit en global ledare inom väte och utnyttjar sin ingenjörskompetens, tillsammans med en betydande tillgångsbas och expertis, för att göra renare energi till verklighet världen över.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Linde Gas**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105985

title: Software Engineering Manager - Container and Virtualisation Infrastructure
description:
Our mission is to build a next-generation private cloud infrastructure, combining KVM, Ceph, and SDN technologies to create a data center scale cloud that 'just works' and provides a mission-critical cloud for edge and core enterprise deployments. We're hiring engineering managers with experience in high-quality microservice architectures and high-performance team leadership who also have deep familiarity with Linux kernel, virtualisation, storage and networking.
   

  

 LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management API/CLI. Our most effective engineers are fluent in all these layers, and able to anticipate the consequences of design and engineering choices elsewhere in a complex distributed system.
   

  

 As an engineering manager at Canonical you must have a solid technical background, but your responsibility is to run an effective team and develop the colleagues you manage. You are expected to help them grow as engineers, do important work, do it outstandingly well, find professional and personal satisfaction, and work well with colleagues and the community. Technical leadership experience and a background in software engineering are necessary prerequisites for this role. You will be expected to lead, challenge, and develop engineers, positively influence the culture, facilitate technical delivery, and work with your team on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The successful candidate will have experience leading successful, collaborative engineering teams, and demonstrate the ability to solve challenging distributed systems problems and deep knowledge of Linux.
   

  

***Location***
 : This is a remote position available in EMEA and the Americas.
   

  

 What you will focus on
   

  

* Lead a team of remote engineers
* Develop talent through coaching, mentoring, feedback and hands-on career development
* Set and manage expectations with other engineering teams, senior management, and external stakeholders
* Advocate and advance modern software development practices
* Participate in the engineering process through code and architectural review
* Engage with teams at Canonical, the open source community and partners
* Work from home with global travel for 4 to 6 weeks per year for internal and external events


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* You understand modern Linux cloud computing technologies, including networking, storage, containers and K8s
* You love developing and growing people and have a strong track record of doing it
* You are focused on success and the delivery of timely, high quality software
* You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree
* You have strong written and verbal technical communication skills
* You have experience programming in C and/or Go.


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Digital Analyst till Adding Insight
description:
Adding Insight är en specialistbyrå inom digital analys grundad 2015. Under åren har de arbetat tätt med kunder som IKEA, Dustin, Tele2, Axfood, Fortnox, SBAB och Epidemic Sound.
   

  

 De är för närvarande fyra personer i teamet, men efterfrågan från kunderna är stor och för att kunna hjälpa flera önskar man att växa med ytterligare seniora personer. Affärskulturen präglas av schyssta värderingar och kundsamarbeten av högsta kvalitet.
   

  

 Om rollen
   

  

 Som konsult hos Adding Insight arbetar du i ett par parallella projekt med fokus på digital mätning, analys och optimering. Du arbetar nära kundernas marknads- och analysteam, oftast som en integrerad resurs i kundernas team. Du kommer att stötta kunderna i förståelse av hur deras webbplatser eller appar används samt utvärdera och ge förslag på optimering av deras digitala marknadsföring.
   

  

 Uppdragen innebär varierande arbetsuppgifter och inkluderar allt från att ta fram mätplaner, säkerställa en hög datakvalitet till att vara med och förbättra webbplatser och appar. Du kommer främst att arbeta med verktygen Google Analytics, Piwik Pro, Matomo, Microsoft Excel,Google Looker Studio, Google Tag Manager, Optimizely, WVO och Google BigQuery.
   

  

 Adding Insight främjar kundsamarbeten med fokus på jämställdhet och en klimat-positiv framtid. Man arbetar främst med mellanstora och stora företagskunder i Norden. Det här är en självständig roll som konsult i ett litet bolag på fyra personer med hög digital kompetens. Du rapporterar direkt till VD och grundare Daniel Ford.
   

  

 Om dig
   

  

 Till rollen söker vi dig som är specialiserad inom digital analys och är lika nyfiken som oss på hur man kan använda nya verktyg, teknologier eller processer för att skapa insikter och handlingskraftiga beslutsunderlag.
   

  

* Du har arbetat med liknande uppgifter i minst tre år
* Har ett självständigt arbetssätt och arbetar effektivt tillsammans i team
* Meriterande med erfarenhet av Google Cloud, Javascript och BI-verktyg
* Tidigare erfarenhet som konsult är också meriterande
* Att kunna kommunicera på svenska är önskvärt, men inget krav


 Vårt erbjudande
   

  

 Du kommer till en specialiserad och välskött byrå där du har möjlighet att utvecklas tillsammans med seniora digitala analytiker och uppdrag i absolut framkant. För rätt person finns det stora möjligheter att vara med och bygga Adding Insight framåt.
   

  

* Konkurrenskraftig lön
* Optionsprogram
* Flexibla arbetstider och distansarbete
* Friskvård 5.000 kr per år
* Trygghet och sjukvårdsförsäkring
* En schysst, prestigelös och entreprenöriell arbetsmiljö
* Möjlighet till personlig utveckling inom bland annat ledarskap
* Vi tillämpar hybridarbete


 Det här är en rekrytering via Digitalenta. Om det här känns som din nästa utmaning så skicka in din ansökan idag. Vi intervjuar löpande. Processen innehåller: Intervju, tester samt arbetsprov.

title: Junior SAP Data Consultant
description:
Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all of these services. With our thought leadership and culture of innovation, we apply industry expertise, diverse skill sets and next-generation technology to each business challenge.
   

  

 We believe in inclusion and diversity and supporting the whole person. Our core values comprise of Stewardship, Best People, Client Value Creation, One Global Network, Respect for the Individual and Integrity. Year after year, Accenture is recognized worldwide not just for business performance but for inclusion and diversity too.
   

  

 “Across the globe, one thing is universally true of the people of Accenture: We care deeply about what we do and the impact we have with our clients and with the communities in which we work and live. It is personal to all of us.” –
 **Julie Sweet, Accenture CEO.**
**About our Nordic SAP Business Group:**
 Accenture and SAP have a longstanding relationship that extends more than 40 years. As the leading Nordic SAP transformation partner, we work with SAP end-to-end from product innovation to development and delivery. Together, we are revolutionizing the future of business through major SAP transformation programs with some of the biggest companies.
   

  

 Within our Nordic SAP community, we work with the newest SAP solutions and offerings such as SAP S/4 HANA Cloud, SAP CX, Ariba, SuccessFactors, SAP BTP and SAP RISE.
   

  

 We are now looking to expand our community at scale and are looking for candidates on several positions and seniority levels.
   

  

 To read more about our SAP Practice, visit us at https://www.accenture.com/us-en/services/sap-index
   

  

**SAP Data Nordic Value Tower:**
 Within the SAP Value Tower Data, we offer you the opportunity to work with SAP Data and to grow your knowledge within the area of Information Management, connected to SAP MDG, Master Data Management and Data Migration.
   

  

 We are looking for people who have a genuine interest in Data, want to grow and challenge themselves within that area and work with the best skilled colleagues.
   

  

**Role Overview:**
 As a junior SAP Data Consultant in Accenture’s Nordic SAP Business Group, you will be an integral part of our team supporting our clients SAP transformation projects through acting as a Functional Expert in the Data Migration and/or Data Governance areas. You will work closely with clients, translating their business and functional requirements into SAP design documents and overseeing solution delivery.
   

  

**Example project roles:**
- Advise clients on their data transformation strategies, driving value creation through the positioning of SAP enabled solutions as well as leading solutions from SAP partners and Accenture

- Be part of the data migration stream of an S/4HANA transformation, working with colleagues in delivery centers to execute on their data transformation and data upload strategies

- Work with clients on their transformational journey, by implementing Master Data Governance strategy and processes, following SAP best practices and Accenture’s proven ways of working

**What’s in it for you:**
- Help Accenture deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity

- Be part of our culture and core values in a truly human work environment

- Take part in our highly engaged and diverse global network, for collaboration and delivery

- Enjoy competitive compensation and benefits

- Develop your skills and build an extraordinary career

- Grab significant development and training opportunities to develop your business acumen, consulting toolbox, technical and professional skills

- Get internal coaching, support and guidance from a mentor, to progress in your work and professional career with continuous feedback

- Gain access to comprehensive tools and frameworks supported by our global organization, including implementation methodologies, knowledge databases, industry leading add-on software, expert networks and benchmarks

- Combine business consulting skills with technology strategy know-how

- Transform businesses with the newest technologies and making them data-driven companies

- Work with some of the biggest SAP clients in large global implementation projects

- Be an integral part of innovative SAP transformation projects

- Play a key role in transforming organizations and communities around the world. Let there be change!

**Qualifications**
**Must have:**
- Deep interest in the importance of Data

- Passion about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Strong resonance with Accenture’s values

- Motivation, persistence, eagerness to optimize and drive for excellence

- Strong analytical skills, result-oriented paired with highly structured working style and good sense of responsibility, flexibility and to be a team player

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Eagerness to shape and work in a team-oriented environment

- Strong will to pursue a problem, identify the source and propose possible solutions in collaboration with other team members in a timely manner

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English

- Nordic (Danish, Norwegian, Swedish or Finnish) language spoken

- A Bachelor or Master’s degree

**Very nice to have:**
- Experience with Data Migration and/or Data Governance

- Previous exposure to or user of SAP

- Knowledge in a functional or business process area

- Technical development (programming) background

**Locations**
 Gothenburg, Malmö, Stockholm
   

  

 Thank you for your interest in joining Accenture. Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in the beginning of August and get back to you shortly after.

title: Researcher with focus on AI and Space
description:
*Are you passionate about contributing to sustainable digital solutions for Earth from space? Does the idea of researching and innovating green, reliable, and trustworthy software solutions that bolster Swedish and European digital sovereignty excite you? If you are enthusiastic and curious by nature and enjoy working at the forefront of technology with colleagues and partners, then we might be the perfect fit for each other!*
**About Us**
 RISE Computer Science department is the leading Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence lab in Sweden. You will be joining a unit with a focus on distributed computing in the Edge to Cloud continuum working with Space, Quantum- and High Perfomance Computing. Together with partners and customers from industry and academia we develop sustainable and energy-efficient systems at the frontier of applied science.
   

  

**About The Role**
 You will have the opportunity to work at a leading and rapidly growing research institute with excellent development opportunities. You will contribute to Digital Earth Sweden, the Swedish Space Data Lab, and develop RISE's position within the space sector. In this role, you will help strengthen Swedish and European sovereignty in digital and AI solutions for space. With a scientific mindset, you will engage in applied research, combining theory and practice. This position is a permanent, full-time employment.
   

  

 For this position there might be a security clearance requirement at a later stage
   

  

**Who are you?**
 As a researcher with us, we believe you are a passionate and solution-oriented individual who enjoys combining a scientific approach with practical implementation. We value your personal qualities as much as your technical skills as you will work in a team. As a colleague, we think you are enthusiastic about taking on new opportunities and engaging in social contexts. With your solid skills, flexible working style, and aptitude for abstraction, you thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, and high-tech environment. You are fluent in English but with the ambition to learn Swedish.
   

  

 You have:
   

  

* a PhD in physics, mathematics, earth systems, computer science or equivalent
* experience from software- or web development
* worked with earth observation data or global digital twins
* worked with AI and large foundation models
* excellent writing and communication skills


 Experience from writing funding applications or working with industry is merited but not required.
   

  

**Are we right for each other?**
 At RISE, we like different, and we are convinced that diversity contributes to an innovative environment where we together challenge boundaries and develop new knowledge for the future. With us, passionate problem solvers meet to solve some of the world's most important, and perhaps fun, problems. We cannot promise you an easy job, but what we can promise you is a team of committed colleagues and exciting societal and industrial challenges to tackle. You will work in a dynamic environment that gives you development opportunities both professionally and personally. With us, you get the opportunity to make a real difference. Welcome to RISE Research Institutes of Sweden.
   

  

**Welcome with your application!**
 If this sounds interesting and you want to know more, you are welcome contact recruiting manager Tobias Edman, +46102284887. Last day of application is 1 of September, 2024.
   

  

 Our trade union representatives are Linda Ikatti, Unionen, 010-516 51 61 and Ulf Nordberg, Sveriges Ingenjörer, 010-5166959. Calls from external recruitment companies and sellers were kindly excluded.

title: Software Engineer (Linux/Python or Go) - Container Images
description:
Canonical is building a new generation of Ubuntu-based container images to simplify open-source application deployment across the world. These container images will be free to use with long-term security commitments, and engineered for performance, security and usability. As with Ubuntu, we will work in the open and welcome community participation.
   

  

 In this role, you'll be developing the tools and technology for building and maintaining this new generation of container images. You'll be working with multiple teams, both inside and outside Canonical, to ensure we deliver container images with the highest quality whilst maintaining a seamless Ubuntu user experience. You will also be highly involved in the implementation and maintenance of the Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery automation around these container images, for which you are expected to demonstrate deep insights into container-based DevOps.
   

  

 You will be contributing to fast-moving products like Rocks (OCI images) and Chisel, and thus have the chance to help steer and consolidate this new team. You'll gain experience with numerous container technologies and participate in exciting and exploratory tasks, where your feedback will be critical for the decision-making process. As an engineer, your seniority will be based on your software development background and ability to lead junior team members.
   

  

 Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical. This is an exciting opportunity for experienced software engineers looking for a place to leave their mark, who are passionate about shaping an open source product with the highest quality, with and for the community!
   

  

 What you'll do
   

  

* Build robust, scalable, leading-edge container images
* Work on automated Ci/CD processes for building, testing and publishing our container images
* Write tools and tests for assessing security compliance and cloud-native compatibility
* Work in Python and/or Go to deliver new functionalities to our container-building tools
* Participate in strong engineering process through code and architectural review
* Provide technical feedback for the team's decision-making process
* Engage with the open-source community as a subject-matter expert
* Grow our knowledge base and write documentation
* Work in a collaborative, agile and globally distributed environment
* Mentor and help hiring
* Work from home with global travel up to 15% for internal and external events


 Who you are - at least some of those statements apply to you:
   

  

* You are knowledgeable and passionate about software development
* You are a team player and have experience in collaborative development
* You have worked with CI/CD systems (e.g. Jenkins, GitHub Actions, Concourse CI, etc.)
* You have a track record of delivering timely, high-quality software
* You have experience with container images and containerised operations
* You master at least one container management/orchestration tool (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc.)
* You have significant experience with Python and/or Go
